Title: Data Scientist - (Logistics, Choice)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist - Customer Logistics, Choice to join the Logistics Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

The Customer Logistics tribe‚Äôs mission is to build products that make it easy for local brands to run efficient operations and deliver a delightful order experience to customers so they order on repeat. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions affecting every customer journey across all of Delivery Hero‚Äôs 70+ markets.


Drive the development and implementation of statistical, machine learning, and optimization models for choice optimization, rider fleet busyness and travel time prediction, and demand control. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the efficiency and performance of the machine learning models in across the vertical.
Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities by deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve decision-making in the domain.
Work on research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in machine learning and data science, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's digital products and algorithms. Stay informed about industry developments and incorporate new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows.


What you need to be successful


You excel at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver value to the business.
You have expertise in building and training advanced machine learning models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit ideally centring around Pandas, SQL, Sklearn, and PySpark.
Through the fluent use of SQL queries, you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine-learning solutions.
You write clean, production-level code and effectively use software versioning with Git.
You are familiar with deploying and developing in cloud systems, ideally with experience in GCP and bigquery.
You love to learn and are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence; you are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different tech teams in a diverse environment.


Nice to have:


Proven experience in addressing large-scale optimization problems (linear or mixed integer programming) is a strong asset.
Hands-on experience in creating causal models and deploying them in production is a plus.
Experience in designing and analysing advanced products/models experiments (switchback tests, quasi-experiments, non-standard A/B tests etc) is a plus.
Experience in working on logistics product development would be a great benefit.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.




Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Frontend Engineer - Ads & Ancillaries (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio's vision is to enable seamless travel for people anywhere, in any way. We are bringing all global transport options into a single distribution system to create magical end-to-end consumer journeys.

With Omio, you can easily compare and book trains, buses, ferries, and flights across Europe, the US, and Canada using a single search on your mobile, app, or desktop. Omio aims to simplify travel planning by providing transparent pricing and easy booking, making it a flexible and personalised experience.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, working with over 1000 suppliers across 39 countries. Our portfolio also includes Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, attracting over 900 million users annually.

Our offices are located in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London. We are a growing team of over 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who all share the same vision: to create a unified tool to help travellers reach almost any destination in the world.

Job Description

We are looking for a Frontend Engineer to join our key AAA (Ads & Ancillaries) Team. You'll be solving very relatable user problems and help build a truly outstanding product experience for travellers from all over the world while they're searching, comparing and booking their best journey.

Features will be shipped across all Omio's front-ends with the aim of monetizing user traffic while delivering superb user experience.

What You Will Do


Create robust frontend solutions using state-of-the-art technologies. You will build components that are used throughout all of Omio‚Äôs frontends (mobile, desktop, apps)
Work with your team to rapidly test ideas on users, use results for iterations and improve our product
Test new languages, libraries and frameworks and evaluate their potential to make sure we never stop innovating. You will share best practices with other teams and help make those a company standard.
Build highly reusable frontend components that can be dynamically mounted in any react frontend
Apply your engineering experience to automate processes and help to guide the team during the decision making


Our Tech Stack


Typescript/Javascript, React, React Native, ES6, Rest API/GraphQL, Styled components, Jest, Cypress, Kubernetes, GitHub
Check more details: https://omio.tech/radar


Qualifications

You Are:


Customer-focused: You have a passion for building front-ends that users genuinely enjoy and helps them get the most out of our product
Up to code: You have more than 3 years plus of experience in software development, you write clean, lean, effective code, all version controlled. You pick the right tool for the job and are not limited to a single paradigm or language
Pragmatic: You and your team take on complex multi-domain problems, analyse, design, build modular solutions, and deliver end-to-end in an MVP, value-first and iterative approach
An automator: You remove repetition and snowflakes through scripting and automation tools. Whatever can be automated will be automated. You have deployed, monitored, and supported applications across stacks and technologies
A tuning expert: You have improved performance and analysed bottlenecks in production systems through benchmarks and stress tests. You are no stranger to profiling a front-end.
A team player: You guide and help your teammates with planning and delivering high-quality software and also take on communication across teams


Additional Information

Learn more about Omio Engineering and our Team:


https://medium.com/omio-engineering
https://www.omio.com/corporate


Here at Omio, we know that no two people are alike, and that‚Äôs a great thing. Diversity in culture, thought and background has been key to growing our product beyond borders to reach millions of users from all over the world. That‚Äôs why we believe in giving equal opportunity to all, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind of potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

www.omio.com/corporate/jobs
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / ML Specialist
Description:
About Mira

Mira is a San Francisco-based hormonal health company providing integrative care and hormonal testing for over 92,000 customers. In 2023, they were recognized by Inc. 5000 as America's fastest-growing femtech company. We started our company to help women and individuals reach their parenthood dreams and make their fertility journey smoother.

Mira‚Äôs most important breakthrough was inventing the market's only FDA-compliant at-home fertility monitor with quantitative technology. Since the beginning, they have been on a mission to develop data-driven hormonal health solutions to help women make confident health decisions during every stage of their lives‚Äîfrom the menstrual stage to menopause. Mira offers solutions to test, boost, and navigate fertility‚Äîstarting from comprehensive hormone testing and supplements to fertility coaching and online courses.

We are committed to helping our customers achieve the highest possible success rates and outcomes; that is why our focus is on personalized care, the use of the most cutting-edge technology, and science-backed data.

About The Position

We seek a Data Scientist / ML Specialist for a 3‚Äì6 month engagement to upgrade our core product algorithms. This project requires integrating collected data and dynamic modeling techniques to enhance the precision and reliability of predictions. The contractor will collaborate closely with product, medical and engineering teams to deliver practical, production-ready solutions.

If want to challenge yourself at a high-growth startup and make a difference for women's health please join us!

Responsibilities


Data Collection & Preprocessing
Labeling & Model Development
Implement function-based or semi-supervised labeling strategies to create training data for recurring events.
Build and refine predictive models for recurring events and models for confirmation of the events.
Feature Engineering
Design personalized features (historical patterns, user clustering) for better model adaptability.
Incorporate user demographics and additional data reported by users where appropriate to increase accuracy of the algorithm.
Iterative Testing & Validation
Compare new models against baseline metrics and optimize algorithms based on real-world feedback.
Conduct A/B testing or controlled rollouts for final validation.
Integration & Documentation
Collaborate with backend engineers to ensure efficient model deployment and data flow.
Maintain clear technical documentation for data transformations, model decisions, and performance outcomes.


Requirements


Technical Expertise
Minimum 3 years of experience in data science or machine learning, with a focus on time-series or biological data.
Modeling & Analysis
Proven track record in advanced machine learning for adaptive, personalized recommendations or forecasting.
Familiarity with labeling techniques, semi-supervised learning, or similar methods.
Data Wrangling Skills
Capable of cleaning, structuring, and integrating large or messy datasets for model readiness.
Comfortable with data imputation and handling incomplete user inputs.
Project Delivery
Able to manage a defined project scope within 3‚Äì6 months, iterating rapidly and adjusting as needed.
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers) on production systems.
Communication
Able to communicate results effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Willing to provide regular progress updates and clear documentation of all work.




Details


Short-term remote contract, estimated at 3‚Äì6 months.
Independent role requiring structured progress reports and milestone deliverables.
Potentially flexible schedule with a requirement for occasional overlap with the product team‚Äôs time zone.


What We Offer


An opportunity to create a tangible impact in women‚Äôs health technology.
A supportive, collaborative environment that values results and innovation.
Competitive compensation aligned with expertise and project scope.
Potential for expanded collaboration following successful engagement.


Recruiting process

Step 1 ‚ÄòScreening call with HR‚Äô - Step 2 ‚ÄòInterview Head of Product‚Äô - Step 3 ‚ÄòProject review with Head of Product and CTO‚Äô - Step 4 ‚ÄòFinal interview with the management team (CMO, CTO, CEO, Head of Product)‚Äò

Title: Data Scientist in Energy Tech Start Up - hybrid Berlin based (f/m/d)
Description:
Digitalization and energy transition in one sentence? That‚Äôs what we do at Green Fusion! Our software optimizes heating systems in the real estate sector, helping to combat climate change through digitalization and automation. We reduce emissions and energy consumption, actively advancing the energy transition.




As a Data Scientist, you‚Äôll support our Energy Optimization Team by developing production-ready algorithms that optimize heating system operations. With a basic understanding of heating systems and strong expertise in control technology, you‚Äôll bring essential insights to help us develop effective tools for energy optimization.


Tasks



Data Analysis: Clean and analyze data to identify patterns and trends, uncovering insights that drive our solutions.


Statistical Analysis: Use statistical techniques to interpret data, ensuring the reliability and accuracy of your findings.


Data Science: Create data models to predict heating system behavior and patterns using advanced analytics techniques and machine learning.


Algorithm Development: Create production-ready algorithms and data pipelines to optimize energy system components, reducing CO2 emissions and enhancing energy efficiency.


Collaboration: You will be responsible for the entire process of developing product features, from understanding customer requirements to final feature deployment. This requires seamless collaboration with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, product and customer success managers.


Research Support: Conduct experimental data analysis to refine and improve energy optimization algorithms.


Clear Communication: Present findings in a concise and understandable manner.


Additional tasks: Support our team in creating data models to predict energy time series data (e.g. heat demand, solar production, electricity consumption) and in optimizing energy systems using machine learning algorithms ((Un)supervised and Reinforcement Learning).



Requirements



Location: You are living in Berlin.





Experience





At least three years of professional experience in data science. Familiar with product lifecycles (Feasibility studies, requirement engineering, production-ready tool development, code reviews, feature deployments, continuous maintenance and improvement).





Must haves





Strong skills in statistics, data modeling, data analysis and machine learning.


Educational background in: electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics or computer science, data science, mathematics with a strong background in energy tech.





Technical Knowledge





Expertise in developing prediction models and working with energy time series data.


Proficient in Python, SQL, GraphQL, REST, and data science libraries like Pandas, SciPy, and Scikit-Learn. Machine Learning Operations skills are a plus.


Hands-on experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative coding practices.






Testing: Familiarity with testing frameworks and quality assurance practices to ensure robust and reliable product features.


Programming Style: Your code is clean, well-structured, maintainable, and easy to understand for team collaboration.


Communication: You are comfortable collaborating and communicating effectively with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, and customer success managers.


Customer Focus: A strong understanding of customer needs and how they translate into technical solutions.


Language Skills: Fluent in English, with basic German.



Benefits


üè† Flexible working hour models, home office, and remote work.




üí° Ongoing training opportunities ‚Äì whether through job challenges, our open feedback culture, or sponsored training programs, there are always opportunities to learn and grow.




üíº Employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.




üå± Direct impact through your job ‚Äì with us, you can actively contribute to the energy transition and fight against climate change every day.




üíö We value our team ‚Äì that's why regular team events are very important to us.




üôå The best team that Berlin has to offer ‚Äì and maybe even beyond. Don‚Äôt believe it? Then find out for yourself and apply now!




---




While we are still considered pioneers today, we can soon dominate the market with you! First in the DACH region, then throughout Europe.




You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment that is passionate and ambitious about actively shaping the energy transition ‚Äì a goal that can only be achieved together!




We look forward to your application ‚Äì Fernanda will get in touch with you!

  • Algorithm Development: Create production-ready algorithms and data pipelines to optimize energy system components, reducing CO2 emissions and enhancing energy efficiency.

  • Collaboration: You will be responsible for the entire process of developing product features, from understanding customer requirements to final feature deployment. This requires seamless collaboration with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, product and customer success managers.

  • Research Support: Conduct experimental data analysis to refine and improve energy optimization algorithms.

  • Clear Communication: Present findings in a concise and understandable manner.

  • Additional tasks: Support our team in creating data models to predict energy time series data (e.g. heat demand, solar production, electricity consumption) and in optimizing energy systems using machine learning algorithms ((Un)supervised and Reinforcement Learning).


Requirements

  • Location: You are living in Berlin.


Experience



  • At least three years of professional experience in data science. Familiar with product lifecycles (Feasibility studies, requirement engineering, production-ready tool development, code reviews, feature deployments, continuous maintenance and improvement).


Must haves



  • Strong skills in statistics, data modeling, data analysis and machine learning.

  • Educational background in: electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics or computer science, data science, mathematics with a strong background in energy tech.


Technical Knowledge



  • Expertise in developing prediction models and working with energy time series data.

  • Proficient in Python, SQL, GraphQL, REST, and data science libraries like Pandas, SciPy, and Scikit-Learn. Machine Learning Operations skills are a plus.

  • Hands-on experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative coding practices.



  • Testing: Familiarity with testing frameworks and quality assurance practices to ensure robust and reliable product features.

  • Programming Style: Your code is clean, well-structured, maintainable, and easy to understand for team collaboration.

  • Communication: You are comfortable collaborating and communicating effectively with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, and customer success managers.

  • Customer Focus: A strong understanding of customer needs and how they translate into technical solutions.

  • Language Skills: Fluent in English, with basic German.


Benefits

üè† Flexible working hour models, home office, and remote work.


üí° Ongoing training opportunities ‚Äì whether through job challenges, our open feedback culture, or sponsored training programs, there are always opportunities to learn and grow.


üíº Employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.


üå± Direct impact through your job ‚Äì with us, you can actively contribute to the energy transition and fight against climate change every day.


üíö We value our team ‚Äì that's why regular team events are very important to us.


üôå The best team that Berlin has to offer ‚Äì and maybe even beyond. Don‚Äôt believe it? Then find out for yourself and apply now!


---


While we are still considered pioneers today, we can soon dominate the market with you! First in the DACH region, then throughout Europe.


You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment that is passionate and ambitious about actively shaping the energy transition ‚Äì a goal that can only be achieved together!


We look forward to your application ‚Äì Fernanda will get in touch with you!

Title: (Principal) Data Scientist
Description:
We are Gemma Analytics: a Berlin-based company specializing in generating insights in high-performance data infrastructure. Gemma was founded in early 2020 by two data enthusiasts. Ever since, we have helped over 70 companies to become more data-driven and successful. We have a fun, honest, and inclusive work environment. We are always looking for data-minded people we can learn from.


Tasks


About the Job




At Gemma Analytics, we help businesses unlock the power of data to drive smarter decisions. As we expand our capabilities in data science, we‚Äôre looking for a (Principal) Data Scientist to take the lead in shaping and scaling this new vertical.




This is a unique opportunity for a pragmatic and business-focused data scientist who thrives in delivering real-world impact rather than research-driven models. You‚Äôll work hands-on with machine learning, advanced analytics, and AI-driven solutions‚Äîwhile also collaborating with clients and stakeholders to align data science initiatives with business goals.




Responsibilities:





Build the Data Science vertical: Define and develop the capabilities, processes, and strategies to establish data science as a key service


Lead end-to-end data science projects ‚Äì From problem identification to deployment and impact measurement, ensuring models are practical, scalable, and aligned with business needs


Develop and deploy machine learning models ‚Äì Expertise in supervised and unsupervised ML techniques (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) and their application in areas like demand forecasting, churn prediction, and pricing optimization


Act as a trusted advisor, collaborating with clients to understand their challenges and deliver practical, impactful solutions


Stay hands-on with data engineering & analytics ‚Äì Work with SQL, Python (pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy), and modern cloud data stacks (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) to prepare and process data for modeling


Keep up with emerging trends and tools in data science, leveraging them to improve client results and refine internal processes


Cultivate a collaborative and innovative team culture, mentoring junior team members as the vertical grows



Requirements


You're not just a Data Scientist‚Äîyou‚Äôre a builder, problem-solver, and strategic thinker who knows how to balance technical sophistication with business impact.




Besides that, we are looking for the following:





5+ years of hands-on experience in Data Science, with a proven track record of leading and delivering real-world business-focused ML projects


An entrepreneurial spirit and the ability to work autonomously to build new initiatives


Pragmatism in delivering solutions that balance technical sophistication with business feasibility


Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data science libraries; experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus


Experience deploying models in production environments that interact with modern data warehouses and cloud-based ML services


Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to diverse audiences


Optional: Knowledge of data modeling and data engineering concepts to collaborate effectively with technical teams.



Benefits


We are located in Berlin, close to Nordbahnhof. We are currently 19 colleagues and will grow to 22 colleagues this year. Other perks include:





We are a hybrid company that meets in the office twice a week - one common office day and one flexible day


We allow for intra-EU workcations for up to 3 months a year (extra-EU workcations also if this is allowed)


We have an honest, inclusive work environment and want to nurture this environment


We don‚Äôt compromise on equipment - a powerful Laptop, extra screens, and all the tools you need to be effective


We will surround you with great people who love to solve (mostly data) riddles


We believe in efficient working hours rather than long working hours - we focus on the output rather than the input


We learn and share during meetups, lunch & learn sessions and are open to further initiatives


We pay a market-friendly salary and we additionally distribute at least 20% of profits to our employees


We are fast-growing and have technology at our core, yet we do not rely on a VC and operate profitably


We have a great yearly offsite event that brings us all together for a full week, enjoying good food, and having a good time (2021: Austria, 2022: Czech Republic, 2023: Germany, 2024: Germany)






CV screening


Initial conversation


Hiring test


Interviews with 2-3 future colleagues


Reference calls


Offer + Hired
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent employee, Full-time


Berlin


Your Responsibilities


Data Processing & Curation ‚Äì You engage with our internal and public data to create clean datasets as a basis for our energetic simulations
Algorithm Development ‚Äì You develop and tune Algorithms that enhance the quality and efficiency of the energy consultation for our customers
Benchmarking ‚Äì You assess the performance of your algorithms, ensuring they meet our high-quality standards
New Approaches ‚Äì You keep an eye on the latest developments in AI and come up with new approaches to improve our data products


Your profile


Studies & Professional Experience ‚Äì You possess a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, or a related field, complemented by a robust professional track record in data science, with at least 3 years in a Data Science role
Technical Expertise ‚Äì You have excellent Python skills and understanding of common machine learning algorithms, cloud computing and data science software stack
Ingenuity ‚Äì You are a creative and innovative problem solver who loves to overcome challenges
Mindset & Collaboration ‚Äì You're self-organised and thrive working independently, yet are eager to collaborate with everyone. With a 'maker' mindset, you're conceptually adept and shine through your proactive and confident approach


Fuchs & Eule


We take our responsibility for a green future seriously and aim to make a significant contribution to CO2 reduction through our commitment to energy efficiency.
We are ambitious and constantly strive to improve. That‚Äôs why we give people the space to grow and take responsibility, and the support they need.
We are digital, innovative, customer focused and highly motivated to achieve great things with you.
We are a real team and support each other, speak our minds, have fun together and have a genuine desire to make a positive difference.
We understand the importance of in-person interactions versus virtual ones, which is why we have thoughtfully designed our office in Berlin and focus on team events. At the same time, we place a high value on flexibility, allowing our team to work from home two days a week.


Apply for this job

About Us

Now is the time to take action and fight the climate crisis. We want to support as many homeowners as possible to make their homes energy efficient and receive the best possible funding.

Residential homes are responsible for a significant percentage of global CO2 emissions and the pressure from high energy costs is higher than ever, but the path to a climate-neutral home with optimal funding is complicated. We combine expertise in the energy and buildings sector with practical project support and digital innovation, helping people and the environment in equal measures.

Apply for this job

We look forward to receiving your convincing application!

We are excited about your interest in Valyria. Please fill out the following short form.

Title: ML Engineer - MedTech Startup
Description:
About Us:

Nucs AI is an innovative MedTech startup revolutionizing the management of prostate cancer through AI-powered solutions. We develop advanced medical software that leverages cutting-edge machine learning models to assist healthcare providers in diagnosing and treating prostate cancer. As we finalize our seed investment round, we are seeking a talented AI/ML Engineer to join our growing team and contribute to the development of our pioneering technology.

Why Join Us?

Impactful Work: Directly contribute to AI-driven solutions that improve patient outcomes and save lives.

Innovative Environment: Collaborate with a forward-thinking team using cutting-edge AI and machine learning technologies.

Professional Growth: Own key projects, expand your AI/ML expertise, and work on real-world healthcare applications.

Startup Culture: Join a dynamic, fast-paced work environment where your contributions make a tangible impact.

Position Overview:

As an ML Engineer at Nucs AI, you will be at the forefront of developing and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models to power our AI-driven medical software solutions. Your role will involve building algorithms that analyze medical images and data, driving innovation in prostate cancer diagnosis and treatment. You will work closely with our engineering teams to ensure that our AI models are scalable, secure, and aligned with clinical and regulatory standards.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development: Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for medical image analysis, leveraging deep learning techniques (e.g., CNNs, Vision Transformers, Multi-Modal LLMs).
Data Processing: Build data pipelines to clean, preprocess, and augment large datasets of medical images, ensuring the highest accuracy of AI models.
Integration: Collaborate with back-end developers to integrate AI models into our software solutions for seamless deployment in clinical environments.
Cloud-Based AI: Develop scalable AI solutions on cloud platforms (Google Cloud preferred) using tools such as PyTorch, ONNX Runtime or similar.
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure AI models and data processing adhere to healthcare regulations like HIPAA and meet medical industry standards.
Evaluation Pipeline: Build strong evaluation pipelines to extract insights about trained model performance.



What We‚Äôre Looking For (must-haves):


Strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks: PyTorch and ONNX
Experience with medical imaging technologies and datasets: DICOM, NIFTY and similar
Expertise in developing deep learning models for 3D image segmentation.
Strong expertise in fine-tuning and deployment of multi-modal LLMs
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Google Cloud or AWS)



Previous experience with PACS integration is a strong plus.

What We Offer:


An exciting and dynamic work environment in the cutting-edge MedTech industry.
Opportunities to work closely with the leadership team and contribute to the development of innovative products.
Competitive salary and potential for growth within the company.
Stock options, providing an opportunity to own a part of our rapidly growing startup.
Flexible working hours and remote work options, along with regular communication and participation in team meetings.



How to Apply:

If you are passionate about AI/ML and excited about contributing to the future of healthcare technology, we want to hear from you! Please send your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and explaining why you‚Äôre interested in this role.

Join Nucs AI and help transform the future of prostate cancer management with innovative, AI-powered solutions!


PyTorch & ONNX
Fine-tuning multi-modal LLMs
Google Cloud or AWS experience
3D Image Segmentation
Ability to work with data formats like DICOM and NIFTY
Located in Berlin
Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer Intern
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Vinterns 2025

Our Vintern programme offers a unique opportunity to dive into the professional world with our industry-leading teams. This initiative is designed not just to bolster your resume with impactful work experience, but also to enhance your interpersonal skills through collaborative projects with fellow Vinterns. Here‚Äôs a glimpse of what to expect:


Hands-On Work Experience: Spend 85% of your time working closely with your team, contributing to meaningful projects and gaining insights from experienced professionals.
Collaborative Learning: Dedicate 15% of your time to work alongside other Vinterns, embarking on joint projects that foster teamwork, innovation, and critical thinking.
Personal and Professional Growth: Our programme is tailored to support your development in every sense, preparing you for a successful future by nurturing both your personal attributes and professional skills.


The programme extends from July 1st to October 3rd. To maximise the benefits of the Vintern programme, successful applicants must be available for the entire duration.

In the first week, all interns are invited to our HQ in Vilnius for communal onboarding. It's a fantastic way to meet everyone and get a feel for our culture.

Information about the position

As an intern, you will be responsible for completing a data pipeline project end-to-end. This will involve clarifying requirements, creating technical write-ups and/or proposals, and contributing to the existing codebase, primarily in SQL, and carrying out some typical day-to-day tasks such as code reviews, debugging, triaging and resolving issues, contributing to team rituals and discussions.

As part of a centralised team of Analytics Engineers in the Vinted Go Business Unit, you will participate in team rituals, meetings, and knowledge sharing sessions, and gain general insights

about the different domains in Vinted Go, their data and applications. You will work directly with Analytics Engineers in the Business Unit and will report to a senior Analytics Engineer who will support and mentor you.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Learn about Analytics Engineering principles and best practices
Gain a deeper understanding of theoretical concepts relevant to the field (i.e. data modeling)
Practice and develop technical skills that are relevant in any data role (i.e. SQL, version control)
Support an established team in expanding its data product capabilities
Build end-to-end pipeline(s) as part of a project using dbt, BigQuery, Airflow
Learn about the day-to-day responsibilities and tasks that Analytics Engineers own
Practice writing and reviewing technical proposals and documentation


About You


Eager to learn
Problem solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communications skills in English
Ready to commit, own and create
Interested in data and its applications in a business environment
Passionate about technical solutions


Work perks


Gym Membership
Lunch allowance
Team building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
Dog friendly office
Public transport benefit.


Working at Vinted

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The internship pay is 2685 euros/month gross.

The application window closes on the 21st of March 2025.

The application window closes on the 21st of March 2025.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Machine Learning Engineer(d/f/m) at Aignostics, you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. You will develop distributed software systems for machine learning applications that will help to improve cancer research and diagnostics. Together with your colleagues you will take care of the machine learning software stack and thereby enable our teams to build medical grade quality and scalable machine learning models.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Please note that this position is intended for software engineers with some data science experience, for a data scientist / machine learning / deep learning position please checkout our Data Scientist opening.

Where your expertise is needed


Implement, improve and maintain ML pipelines to make them usable, efficient and scalable.
Engage in code reviews, upholding high standards for clean, reliable code.
Embrace learning new technologies, fostering innovation, and tackling diverse challenges.
Work in an agile development environment and clearly communicate your results to the team.


What We Are Looking For


Degree in Computer Science or an engineering focused field
2+ years of work experience in software development
Advanced skills in Python, data technologies and computer science in general
Experience with Linux, version control and container technologies
Driven self-starter, well-organized, and a strong team player


Nice to have


Good understanding of distributed systems, parallel computing, system efficiency and scalability
Good understanding of machine learning and data science
Experience with MLOps / DevOps, cloud technologies (Kubernetes) and orchestration
Exposure to biomedical data
Experience software development in regulated environments, specifically considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Werde Data Scientist bei smedo

¬†

√úber uns: Bei smedo sind wir auf einer Mission, die Welt der kontaktlosen Biometrie-Technologie zu revolutionieren. Stell dir vor, du misst Vitalzeichen wie Herzfrequenz, Herzvariabilit√§t und Atemfrequenz, ohne die Person zu ber√ºhren oder zu sehen ‚Äì genau das tun wir! Unsere Technologie ist so pr√§zise und vielseitig, dass es fast wie Magie wirkt (aber es ist einfach wirklich gute Wissenschaft). Werde Teil unseres Teams und mach das Gesundheitswesen intelligenter, Herzschlag f√ºr Herzschlag.




Aufgaben:

Tauche in Datenmeere ein und fische die wertvollsten Erkenntnisse heraus.
Entwickle und implementiere Machine-Learning-Modelle, die unsere Technologie noch schlauer machen.
Arbeite mit brillanten K√∂pfen aus verschiedenen Abteilungen zusammen, um reale Probleme zu l√∂sen.
Pr√§sentiere deine Ergebnisse den Stakeholdern so, dass selbst deine Oma sie versteht.
Halte unsere Dateninfrastruktur am Laufen, als w√§re sie eine gut ge√∂lte Maschine.




Anforderungen:

Nachgewiesene Erfahrung als Data Scientist (wir sprechen von echter Erfahrung, nicht nur einem schicken Titel).
Beherrschung statistischer Methoden und Datenanalyse (die Dinge, die dich wie einen Zauberer aussehen lassen).
Beherrschung von Python (weil wer liebt nicht eine gute Programmiersprache?).
Erfahrung mit Machine-Learning-Frameworks (Extrapunkte, wenn du unseren Modellen das Tanzen beibringen kannst).
Vertrautheit mit Radar ist von Vorteil (wir sprechen nicht vom Wetter).
Hervorragende Probleml√∂sungsf√§higkeiten und Detailgenauigkeit (denn der Teufel steckt im Detail).
Starke Kommunikations- und Teamf√§higkeiten (wir sind eine freundliche Truppe, versprochen).
Professionelle Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (damit du uns in zwei Sprachen beeindrucken kannst).




Was wir bieten:

Eine kollaborative und innovative Arbeitsumgebung (wo deine Ideen z√§hlen).
M√∂glichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung (weil wir an dein Potenzial glauben).
Wettbewerbsf√§higes Gehalts- und Leistungspaket (wir wissen, dass du es wert bist).




Bewerbung: Wenn du leidenschaftlich an Data Science interessiert bist und einen echten Unterschied machen m√∂chtest, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung! Nutze den Bewerbungsprozess von LinkedIn und lass uns gemeinsam Datenmagie erschaffen!




-----------------------------




Become a Data Scientist at smedo

¬†

About Us: At smedo, we are on a mission to revolutionize the world of contactless biometric technology. Imagine measuring vital signs like heart rate, heart variability, and respiration rate without even touching or seeing the person ‚Äì that's what we do! Our tech is so precise and versatile, it feels like magic (but it's just really good science). Join us and be part of a team that's making healthcare smarter, one heartbeat at a time.

¬†

Responsibilities:

Dive into oceans of data and fish out the most valuable insights.
Craft and deploy machine learning models that make our tech even smarter.
Team up with brilliant minds across departments to solve real-world problems.
Present your findings to stakeholders in a way that even your grandma would understand.
Keep our data infrastructure running smoother than a well-oiled machine.

¬†

Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist (we're talking about real experience, not just a fancy title).
Mastery of statistical methods and data analysis (you know, the stuff that makes you look like a wizard).
Proficiency in Python (because who doesn't love a good programming language?).
Experience with machine learning frameworks (bonus points if you can teach our models to dance).
Familiarity with Radar is a plus (we're not talking about the weather kind).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail (because the devil is in the data).
Strong communication and teamwork abilities (we're a friendly bunch, promise).
Proficiency in both German and English at a professional level (so you can impress us in two languages).

¬†

What We Offer:

A collaborative and innovative work environment (where your ideas matter).
Opportunities for professional growth and development (because we believe in your potential).
Competitive salary and benefits package (we know you're worth it).

¬†

How to Apply: If you're passionate about data science and ready to make a real impact, we want to hear from you! Apply now through LinkedIn application process and hear from us soon!¬†

Title: Staff Data Scientist (New Verticals)
Description:
Job Description

About the New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt the best place to order what you need, be it groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, or other goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world‚Äôs best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!)

About The Marketing & Affordability Analytics Team

Our Marketing & Affordability Analytics team uncovers insights on growth opportunities and consumer experience. We partner with Product, Engineering and Business teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You‚Äôll collaborate with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals who take ownership of the business outcomes. As we‚Äôre looking to grow to the next level of maturity, you‚Äôll play a key role in establishing analytical expertise in various business domains.

About The Role

We‚Äôre looking for an awesome Staff Data Scientist in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You will be the partner for the New Verticals business and act as the go-getter analytics expert of your domain. You‚Äôll have an opportunity to make a domain-wide impact, by partnering with senior leaders closely and driving the action from the frontlines.

The scope of the role ranges from helping cross-functional teams use various data points to size the potential opportunities, identifying and measuring levers to help move essential metrics, leveraging your technical and analytical skills to tell stories about business performance and make recommendations, and aligning executives around what matters and why.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
6+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position
Expertise with SQL and statistical analysis using Python, R, or equivalent.
Strong know-how on experimentation techniques (A/B testing, causal inference) and hypothesis testing.
Ability to build intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence critical business decisions on senior leadership level, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach independently.
Ability to work and communicate effectively in English.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app ‚Äì we‚Äôre a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we‚Äôre about getting things done. You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we‚Äôre the very core of Wolt‚Äôs products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: ML Engineer - NLP (m/f/d)
Description:
üé§ Why voize? Because we‚Äôre more than just a job!

At voize, we‚Äôre revolutionizing the healthcare industry with AI: Nurses simply speak their documentation into their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each nurse an average of 39 minutes per day, improves the quality of documentation, and makes their daily work much more rewarding.

voize is YCombinator-funded, already in use at over 600 senior care homes, and has grown by 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually ‚Äì time spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our self-developed voize AI, we‚Äôre transforming not only the healthcare industry, but also have the potential to create value in many other sectors ‚Äì from healthcare to inspections.

As a dynamic team, we blend cutting-edge technology with social impact. And now, it‚Äôs your turn to join us!

üí° Your Mission

If you're excited to work at the cutting edge of product design, applied ML research, and MLOps, then go ahead and apply! With us, you'll build products with direct user feedback, train AI models with real data, and ship new features to production every day.

üöÄ Your Daily Business ‚Äì No two days are alike


Take ownership for the design, training, evaluation, and deployment of our deep learning models in the space of speech recognition and NLP
The models you build and refine are at the heart of our applications and directly impact the end-user
You'll get to engineer large self-supervised trainings as well as fast inference for mobile devices and hosted environments


ü§ù Your Skillset ‚Äì What You Bring To The Table


Several years production experience with Python and deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch)
Experience in speech recognition or NLP & transformer models (TTS, STT)
Best practices in software engineering come second-nature to you, like Git, Testing, Docker, Clean-code, etc.
You speak business fluent English (C1 minimum) to communicate effectively with our team and customers
Nice to have: German language skills would be a bonus


üéØ Our Success Mindset ‚Äì How we work at voize


Resilience is one of your strengths ‚Äì you see challenges as opportunities, not obstacles
Iterative working suits you ‚Äì you test, learn, and improve constantly instead of waiting for perfection
Communication & feedback come naturally to you ‚Äì you openly address issues and both give and receive constructive feedback


üå± Growing together ‚Äì what you can expect at voize


Become a co-creator of our success with virtual stock options
Our office is in Berlin, and we offer remote work
We provide flexible working hours because you know best when you work most efficiently!
Access to various learning platforms (e.g., Blinkist, Audible, etc.)
We have an open culture and organize regular work weeks and team events to collaborate and bond
We are a fast-growing startup, so you'll encounter various challenges, providing the perfect foundation for rapid personal growth
Your work will make a real impact, helping alleviate the workload for healthcare professionals
Free Germany Ticket and Urban Sports Club membership
30 days of vacation ‚Äì plus your birthday off


‚ú® Ready to talk? Apply now! üöÄ

We look forward to your application and can‚Äôt wait to meet you ‚Äì no matter who you are or what background you have!

HTML:
üé§ Why voize? Because we‚Äôre more than just a job!

At voize, we‚Äôre revolutionizing the healthcare industry with AI: Nurses simply speak their documentation into their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each nurse an average of 39 minutes per day, improves the quality of documentation, and makes their daily work much more rewarding.

voize is YCombinator-funded, already in use at over 600 senior care homes, and has grown by 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually ‚Äì time spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our self-developed voize AI, we‚Äôre transforming not only the healthcare industry, but also have the potential to create value in many other sectors ‚Äì from healthcare to inspections.

As a dynamic team, we blend cutting-edge technology with social impact. And now, it‚Äôs your turn to join us!

üí° Your Mission

If you're excited to work at the cutting edge of product design, applied ML research, and MLOps, then go ahead and apply! With us, you'll build products with direct user feedback, train AI models with real data, and ship new features to production every day.

üöÄ Your Daily Business ‚Äì No two days are alike

  • Take ownership for the design, training, evaluation, and deployment of our deep learning models in the space of speech recognition and NLP
  • The models you build and refine are at the heart of our applications and directly impact the end-user
  • You'll get to engineer large self-supervised trainings as well as fast inference for mobile devices and hosted environments

ü§ù Your Skillset ‚Äì What You Bring To The Table

  • Several years production experience with Python and deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch)
  • Experience in speech recognition or NLP & transformer models (TTS, STT)
  • Best practices in software engineering come second-nature to you, like Git, Testing, Docker, Clean-code, etc.
  • You speak business fluent English (C1 minimum) to communicate effectively with our team and customers
  • Nice to have: German language skills would be a bonus

üéØ Our Success Mindset ‚Äì How we work at voize

  • Resilience is one of your strengths ‚Äì you see challenges as opportunities, not obstacles
  • Iterative working suits you ‚Äì you test, learn, and improve constantly instead of waiting for perfection
  • Communication & feedback come naturally to you ‚Äì you openly address issues and both give and receive constructive feedback

üå± Growing together ‚Äì what you can expect at voize

  • Become a co-creator of our success with virtual stock options
  • Our office is in Berlin, and we offer remote work
  • We provide flexible working hours because you know best when you work most efficiently!
  • Access to various learning platforms (e.g., Blinkist, Audible, etc.)
  • We have an open culture and organize regular work weeks and team events to collaborate and bond
  • We are a fast-growing startup, so you'll encounter various challenges, providing the perfect foundation for rapid personal growth
  • Your work will make a real impact, helping alleviate the workload for healthcare professionals
  • Free Germany Ticket and Urban Sports Club membership
  • 30 days of vacation ‚Äì plus your birthday off

We look forward to your application and can‚Äôt wait to meet you ‚Äì no matter who you are or what background you have!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Pricing Team (m / f / d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio's vision is to enable seamless travel for people anywhere, in any way. We are bringing all global transport options into a single distribution system to create magical end-to-end consumer journeys.

With Omio, you can easily compare and book trains, buses, ferries, and flights across Europe, the US, and Canada using a single search on your mobile, app, or desktop. Omio aims to simplify travel planning by providing transparent pricing and easy booking, making it a flexible and personalised experience.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, working with over 1000 suppliers across 39 countries. Our portfolio also includes Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, attracting over 900 million users annually.

Our offices are located in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London. We are a growing team of over 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who all share the same vision: to create a unified tool to help travellers reach almost any destination in the world.

Job Description

Omio is building the future of travel pricing. We‚Äôre moving from manual, rule-based systems to AI-driven dynamic pricing to enhance revenue, efficiency, and competitiveness. As we transition, we‚Äôre looking for someone who can both build cutting-edge solutions and champion this shift within the company.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities


Build Models: Develop machine learning models (e.g., time series, RNNs) to forecast demand and optimisation systems to recommend prices dynamically.
Pilot AI Solutions: Design and implement a Proof of Concept (PoC) for dynamic pricing in a test market.
Evangelize AI Pricing: Advocate for the adoption of AI-driven pricing by demonstrating its value to key stakeholders across the business.
Analyse Large Data: Leverage Omio‚Äôs data and external factors (like competitor pricing) to optimize pricing decisions.
Drive Automation: Set up systems for real-time anomaly detection and automated price adjustments.


Collaborate: Work with Pricing Commercial, Product, and Engineering teams to integrate AI into business workflows and ensure smooth adoption.

Qualifications


At least 3 years experience in building complex models and algorithms.
Proven ability to design and deploy models in production, ideally for pricing or forecasting.
Strong communication and presentation skills to explain technical concepts and influence non-technical stakeholders at a C-level
Self-driven strong individual contributor requiring minimal hands on support
Experience in building production-ready AI systems from scratch is a big plus


Knowledge & Skills


Passion for driving organizational change and inspiring teams to adopt new, data-driven approaches.
Great communication skills with stakeholders (incl. C-Level)
Focus on solving real business problems rather than building models for theoretical problem-solving
Experience with time-series forecasting, anomaly detection, and Bayesian modelling.
Proficiency in Python, with experience in data science libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Experience of building low-latency / near real-time processing systems.


Additional Information

Here at Omio, we know that no two people are alike, and that‚Äôs a great thing. Diversity in culture, thought and background has been key to growing our product beyond borders to reach millions of users from all over the world. That‚Äôs why we believe in giving equal opportunity to all, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Omio encourage you to apply even if you‚Äôre still developing some of these skills! We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age or disability.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Consumer, Payments
Description:
Job Description

About Consumer Analytics at Wolt

As the name Consumer Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organization, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education, ultimately inspiring teams and building value for the Consumer group.

About The Payments Domain

Payment Group at Wolt is building a world-class payment infrastructure for the best customer experience. You‚Äôll be part of the team working on a smooth, scalable, and secure checkout experience adapting to the many use cases of consumers.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect Payments, we're looking for someone like you!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Scientist position.
Experience with the Payments domain - we‚Äôll pay lots of attention to this experience.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app ‚Äì we‚Äôre a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we‚Äôre about getting things done. You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we‚Äôre the very core of Wolt‚Äôs products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: (Senior) Machine Learning Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
We are Kineo, a Berlin-based tech startup developing machine learning solutions that bring real, tangible business value to our clients. Through our expertise, mindset, culture and most importantly with your help we are turning the AI landscape upside down. Are you excited to contribute to meaningful, impactful projects?




Our proposition to you





We vouch to create a space where you can explore different sets of complex problems and data across industries and verticals.


To support you in your personal development, everyone at Kineo has a mentor. When you grow, so does Kineo.


Your decisions matter! You will not have a boss who decides things for you. At Kineo we believe that decisions are best made locally, by the people closest to the problem at hand.


Transparent salary and career planning from day one.


A beautiful office in the centre of Kreuzberg, with tons of benefits, such as free drinks, snacks, consoles etc.


28 days of vacation


A shared revenue model - when Kineo does well, you will benefit financially, too





Success in the role means that you will have





After 2 months: You established yourself as a member of the team and have already contributed to one of our client projects. You have a clear understanding of how we work and can independently navigate our technical architecture.


After 6 months: You are a key member of the team and fully involved in the development of a client project. You will have made notable contributions to our codebase and internal processes.


After 12-24 months: In collaboration with internal science and engineering resources, you lead the development of a client-facing application from the workshop phase to production. You are a trusted expert in a wide variety of machine learning algorithms and you are able to transfer that knowledge to more junior members of the team.





Your Character Traits





You want to achieve something and don't need a "manager" to tell you that. You are eager to have space to take responsibility and grow from that.


You enjoy exploring beyond your immediate tasks and are open to learning new skills. You collaborate across different areas to help the team succeed, even in areas outside your main expertise.


You are a strong communicator with the ability to present ideas clearly and collaborate effectively. You value building positive relationships and working together to achieve shared goals.





You fit in with our team culture if you





Enjoy working in an environment that combines pragmatic, commercial thinking with a strong desire to learn and grow together. We value team players that are curious but convey humility and respect for different opinions.


You actively choose to work in a start-up, with all the ups and downs.


See open feedback, accountability and independent thinking as the foundation for exceptional (team) work.


You embrace Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. You are excited to contribute to an environment where different perspectives are celebrated, and you actively participate in fostering awareness and continuous learning around DEI.



Tasks



You will work as part of smaller teams of 2-3 people on developing machine learning solutions with our clients.


You will conceptualize and implement algorithmic solutions to challenging business problems. This includes prototyping and productionizing of machine learning solutions, and also defining and analysing product use cases together with the customer.


You will own machine learning solutions from the first drop of raw data, all the way into production serving millions of inference requests.



Requirements



An advanced quantitative degree - e.g Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related fields. Strong knowledge of theoretical math and CS.


At least two years of work experience as Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.


Knowledge of working with large structured and unstructured data sets. Knowledge of data engineering tools like Apache Spark is an advantage.


Strong programming skills in Python. We love other languages too, but Python is what we (and you) will use.


We are AI Consultants - ask yourself: Do you want to be a Consultant?


Experience in using a wide range of ML frameworks such as SKLearn, Tensorflow, Torch in production. Experience with domain specific libraries like OpenCV, HuggingFace etc are an advantage.


Good written and verbal communication in both English and German. Most of our clients are German speaking so a level of at least B2 is required for the role.


Resident in Germany. Due to the size of the company, we cannot currently accept applications from other EU/non-EU countries.





We explicitly do not hire anyone who discriminates against people on the basis of religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status or other aspects. We encourage people from LGBTQIA+ and other underrepresented groups to apply.




Last but not least, keep in mind that we are hiring value based, not skill based. That being said, please tell us the following in your contact message:





Why we would love to work with you


Why you want to work with us
Show more
