  • Why you want to work with us

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Berlin
Description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a Senior Applied Scientist (F/M/D) to join the Discovery Collective team in Berlin.

About The Role üñ•Ô∏è
Based in Berlin, we are building a new team to face fashion search challenges. You will be part of a multicultural, innovative, versatile, supportive environment that takes work-life balance seriously. To have a data driven company is one of our priorities. The Search team is working on delivering high quality search results from 5M+ items, for 80+ markets in 8+ languages. You will work with other software engineers and applied scientists to build Vestiaire Collective‚Äôs fashion search & recommendation engine. You will work on hard and fun problems of fashion discovery where personalization matters.

What You will do üëú

Build full pipelines for models to solve use cases for fashion discovery (product recommendation, ranking, personalization‚Ä¶)

Collaborate with business and product and other engineers and applied scientists and deploy your solutions to production.

Ensure model maintenance, monitoring, and scalability are consistently addressed.

Propose and implement R&D POC projects if you identify possible enhancements to the business, and pitch them to the relevant teams.

You will be expected to take on a leadership role on your projects: you will make the appropriate technical choices (algorithms, data transformation, technologies to use), discuss scope & scheduling with collaborators outside the team, and incorporate feedback as needed

Who you are ‚≠ê

Demonstrated ability to create and optimize end-to-end pipelines for machine learning models. You are very familiar with MLOps.

Strong experience in delivering Machine Learning projects which have created impact on production.

Technical knowledge in Deep Learning, Python, SQL, Machine learning & Statistics.

Broad interests in DS and adjacent topics: modelling, statistics, monitoring, data engineering, production.

Experience with cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure), Experience with AB testing

Fluent English (technical interviews will be conducted in English)Initiative, autonomous, communicating with technical and non technical people.

Our Technology Stack includes

Languages: Python, Golang

Application Framework: PyTorch, Airflow, FastAPI, Tensorflow, Torchserve

Data Storage: Snowflake, Redis, Elasticsearch

Others: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Github

More information about our stack : Vestiaire Tech Radar and ourTech Blog

** The role is hybrid, based in Berlin **

What we offer üéÅ

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive compensation and benefits package (i.e 28 days of paid time off)

As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Title: Data Scientist, Internship, Germany - BCG X
Description:
Locations: M√ºnchen | Berlin | Frankfurt

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

You'll be part of our rapidly growing team who will have a chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills in both German and English


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Requirements


Currently enrolled in a university master‚Äôs or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field


Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Additional info

Join the Group

Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now and become part of a community of forward-thinkers. Here, challenges and collaboration go hand in hand, your ideas are valued, and your potential knows no bounds. Let‚Äôs work together to develop innovative solutions and create a lasting impact on businesses and society.

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d) Machine Learning Ops
Description:
As a Machine Learning Operation Engineer (ML OPS) you are part of our ED&AA Unit at Siemens Energy and work on challenging projects from all areas of the energy industry. You will transform Machine Learning models to well-engineered products fulfilling development, deployment and monitoring requirements and standards.

Let‚Äôs Talk About You!

What You Bring


Hands-on experience with ML frameworks, libraries, agile environments and deploying machine learning solutions using DevOps principles.
Excellent knowledge of data science programming languages (Python, R, Scala).
Excellent knowledge of the boto3 AWS SDK or additional SDKs for other cloud platforms.
Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure.
Excellent knowledge of container technologies (docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift etc.).
Familiar with REST API protocol as well as at least model serving technologies (MLFlow, Seldon Core, Kubeflow, TFX, Sagemaker endpoints etc.).
Excellent knowledge of the ML life-cycle.
Experience in creation of CI/CD pipelines for machine learning projects.



How You Will Make An Impact


Deploy, operationalize and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models with a focus on optimization of model hyperparameters, automated retraining and model training, version control and governance and model monitoring and its drift.
Establish model onboarding, operations, and decommissioning workflows.
Track, snapshot & manage assets used to create the models.
Enable collaboration, sharing and standardization of ML pipelines developed by data scientists.
Maintain model asset integrity & persist access control logs.
Certify model behavior meets regulatory & adversarial standards. You will be heavily supported by data scientists and Subject Matter Experts in this task
Support model portability across a variety of platforms. We do not have cloud-agnostic ML pipelines, but dependencies should be minimal.
Certify model performance meets functional and latency requirements.
Evaluate design patterns for model deployment. Evaluate design patterns for unit testing and integration testing for machine learning products.
Create and maintain scalable ML Ops frameworks to support product-specific models.



Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With ~100,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we‚Äôre also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character ‚Äì no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits


An inclusive team culture where you can be yourself
Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
Welfare: flexible welfare programs and health insurance.



https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Remote (preferably based in Germany, ideally Berlin)




Salary: ‚Ç¨65k - ‚Ç¨100k+




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about the transformative potential of AI in education? We are reimagining education through machine learning and AI, and we need talented engineers like you to help shape the future!




Role Overview:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will take full ownership of building and optimizing our AI-driven product. You'll work across both backend and AI systems to enhance the learning experience for our users. Collaborating with a dynamic, high-growth team, you'll help define the future of personalized education.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and optimize machine learning models to power AI-driven tutors, focusing on improving user experience and key performance metrics.
Lead end-to-end ML development: from model discovery, algorithm development, to testing and production deployment.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, backend, and frontend teams to integrate AI features into the product.
Drive innovation in machine learning and AI, continuously improving our product's capabilities and performance.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of machine learning principles and techniques (professional experience is not required, but a solid grasp of fundamentals is necessary).
Experience working on AI projects (academic, personal, or professional) with hands-on model development and experimentation.
Enthusiasm for AI‚Äôs potential impact on the education space.
Self-driven, with the ability to work independently in a fast-paced, growing startup environment.
Familiarity with product development processes and understanding how to leverage AI to drive business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (ability to contribute to both backend and frontend code).
Familiarity with key product metrics such as user growth, retention, and engagement.
Knowledge of deploying machine learning models into production environments.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP): Share in the company‚Äôs success and growth.
Benefits: Access to Urban Sports Club, team-building events, development budgets, and more!
Remote Work: Hybrid model with travel budget for team workations.




We‚Äôre looking for engineers who are excited about AI's potential and want to make a real impact on education. Join our journey to build the future!

Title: AI & Automation Growth Specialist (F/M/D)
Description:
About Stableton

Stableton is an award-winning fintech private market specialist investment firm and Europe's go-to partner for pre-IPO investing. We empower institutional investors, private banks, and wealth managers to access private market opportunities through our unique, passive index fund-like portfolio of the world's most valuable top 20 unicorn companies and institutional co-investment program. With our remote-first culture, a highly motivated global team, and a track record of innovation, we're shaping the future of private market investments. We are now expanding globally!

About The Role

We seek a trailblazing AI and automation expert to revolutionize our go-to-market strategy, growth initiatives, and operations as we scale internationally. If you're a top-performing, entrepreneurial self-starter who thrives on leveraging cutting-edge AI tools, building automated systems or applying AI agents, and making bold moves, this is your chance to drive real impact.

We're seeking someone who breathes innovation, proactively brings new ideas, and stays ahead of AI and automation trends. This role is perfect for someone who thinks beyond boundaries, takes ownership, and executes fearlessly.

If you're obsessed with leveraging AI to transform industries, this is your chance to make an impact at a high-growth fintech on the rise.

Requirements

What We Expect from You


Design and implement AI-powered automation systems and agents that utilize LLMs to transform our operations and growth initiatives.
Proactively generate ideas‚Äîdon't wait for solutions; create them
Stay ahead of the latest AI agents, automation, and workflow optimization trends.
Embrace an entrepreneurial mindset, take full ownership of automation projects, and drive them to success despite any obstacles.
Make bold moves, test quickly, and learn rapidly‚Äîwe want someone who isn't afraid of failure but sees it as a stepping stone to innovation.
Build scalable automation workflows that can be deployed across multiple departments for maximum efficiency and impact.
Contribute to Stableton's overall technology, growth, and marketing strategy, helping shape the company's future.
Apply your knowledge of fintech and investment products to develop AI-driven solutions tailored to our business needs


Who We're Looking For


Innovative AI & Automation Expert - A game-changer who challenges the status quo, persistently seeking disruptive approaches to enhance workflows, productivity, and innovation using LLMs. A fearless self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, high-growth environments
Results-Driven Problem Solver - A highly ambitious and driven individual who takes full ownership, maximizes efficiency through smart and hard work and continuously pushes the boundaries of AI to deliver beyond expectations
Fluent in English (German is a plus but not essential).
At least one year of experience working with AI applications (beyond AI chatbots)
Available to work during European business hours (CET timezone).
Marketing knowledge is a plus, but your expertise in AI and automation is what we value most



Benefits

Why You Should Join Us


Be part of a high-growth, well-funded fintech and pre-IPO specialist investment firm redefining private market investing
Work alongside a hand-picked team of ambitious, highly-skilled professionals led by serial entrepreneurs
Enjoy unparalleled flexibility, responsibility, and a remote-first work environment (work abroad for up to 180 days per year)
A competitive salary and benefits package that reflects your value to the company
Encounter endless opportunities for growth and development within a company that recognizes and rewards bold, innovative thinking


If you're a top-tier AI and automation specialist ready to make a massive impact, we want you on our team. Apply now and join Stableton in revolutionizing capital markets and private market investing!
Show more

  • Apply your knowledge of fintech and investment products to develop AI-driven solutions tailored to our business needs

Who We're Looking For

  • Innovative AI & Automation Expert - A game-changer who challenges the status quo, persistently seeking disruptive approaches to enhance workflows, productivity, and innovation using LLMs. A fearless self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, high-growth environments
  • Results-Driven Problem Solver - A highly ambitious and driven individual who takes full ownership, maximizes efficiency through smart and hard work and continuously pushes the boundaries of AI to deliver beyond expectations
  • Fluent in English (German is a plus but not essential).
  • At least one year of experience working with AI applications (beyond AI chatbots)
  • Available to work during European business hours (CET timezone).
  • Marketing knowledge is a plus, but your expertise in AI and automation is what we value most


Benefits

Why You Should Join Us

  • Be part of a high-growth, well-funded fintech and pre-IPO specialist investment firm redefining private market investing
  • Work alongside a hand-picked team of ambitious, highly-skilled professionals led by serial entrepreneurs
  • Enjoy unparalleled flexibility, responsibility, and a remote-first work environment (work abroad for up to 180 days per year)
  • A competitive salary and benefits package that reflects your value to the company
  • Encounter endless opportunities for growth and development within a company that recognizes and rewards bold, innovative thinking

If you're a top-tier AI and automation specialist ready to make a massive impact, we want you on our team. Apply now and join Stableton in revolutionizing capital markets and private market investing!

Title: Data Scientist, Germany - BCG X
Description:
Locations: M√ºnchen | Berlin | Frankfurt

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills in both German and English


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Additional info

Professional Development

We are committed to your growth. You will have ample opportunities to participate in training programs, workshops, and development initiatives. You will also benefit from coaching and mentoring to further enhance your skills and expertise. At BCG, you can explore new horizons and expand your potential.

Join the Group

Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now and become part of a community of forward-thinkers. Here, challenges and collaboration go hand in hand, your ideas are valued, and your potential knows no bounds. Let‚Äôs work together to develop innovative solutions and create a lasting impact on businesses and society.

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation‚Ñ¢
Description:
SR2 are partnered with a global consultancy who are looking for Data Science specialists.




In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and statistical modeling to help clients uncover trends, patterns, and insights from their data. You will work on projects involving data collection, cleaning, visualization, and interpretation, turning complex datasets into actionable insights that inform business strategy. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in programming languages like Python or R, and experience with data visualisation and statistical techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python and data analysis libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn.
Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Databricks is essential.
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.




Role

6-12+ month contract with high probability of extension
Hybrid with occasional travel to Munich
Candidates have to be based in Germany
2x Stage interview process




If you're passionate about using data to solve real-world business challenges, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Data Scientist - Consumer (Global Discovery)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join the Search & Ranking team within consumer discovery on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.


Develop and Optimize Search Algorithms: Enhance and research new search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization, to deliver the most relevant results to our users.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work as part of a cross-functional team, including Backend Engineers, Product Managers, and Data Engineers, to improve our global search end-2-end.
Analyze and interpret large datasets: Extract meaningful insights to understand relevance problems.
Innovate and Experiment: Identify and apply the best machine learning and statistical methods to solve complex problems, ensuring solutions are scalable and effective in production environments.
Navigate Ambiguity: Define and tackle data science problems amidst ambiguity, ensuring clear problem definitions and actionable insights


At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

What you need to be successful


Experience: Master‚Äôs degree (or Bachelor‚Äôs with 4+ years of work experience) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Theoretical Chemistry, or similar. 2+ years of experience as a data scientist working on applying data science fundamentals to solve complex business problems
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and Python and its ML ecosystem is essential. Experience with Java and Scala is a plus.
Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of a wide variety of ML and statistical methods, including Classical ML, Deep Learning, NLP, and Recommendation Systems. Ability to discern the most suitable approach for different problems.
Search and Ranking ML Algorithms: Hands-on experience with search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization.
Problem-Solving: Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of navigating it to define clear data science problems and solutions. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical solutions.
Collaborative Spirit: Proven experience working in cross-functional teams, contributing effectively to joint projects and achieving common goals. Excellent communication skills to articulate complex ideas and influence stakeholders.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you a passionate AI/ML Engineer looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our team and be at the forefront of AI-driven transformation!

About The Team

Data is the fuel that keeps our world moving, and we at Natuvion are experts in moving large quantities of it. We are a small team of computer science experts dedicated to accelerating data transformation, making it more efficient, pleasant, and secure. Essentially, we operate as a startup within a well-established company. Our team members hold advanced degrees in computer engineering, logic, physics, and related fields, fostering a culture of deep technical expertise and continuous learning. We pride ourselves on our fast-paced development, strong team culture, and open, focused communication.

Why Join Us?


Innovative Projects: Work on designing and implementing fascinating projects like implementing a programming language in conjunction with cutting-edge AI applications.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values open communication and collaboration, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Engage with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to real-world problems.
Professional Growth: Benefit from a culture that encourages continuous learning and professional development.



Your Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms to solve complex problems and enhance our products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Conduct data preprocessing and feature engineering to prepare data for modeling.
Implement and optimize AI techniques such as semantic search, NLP, and recommendation systems.
Ensure code quality and scalability through the use of typing tools like mypy and pyright.
Generate comprehensive documentation and presentations to communicate findings and solutions.
Analyze current AI scenarios, identify gaps, and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning to continuously improve our solutions.



Job requirements

Core Skills


Deep Learning and Machine Learning: Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Understanding of current models and their applications.
AI Techniques and Applications: Experience with various AI techniques such as semantic search, natural language processing (NLP), and recommendation systems.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a strong emphasis on scalable and understandable code using typing tools like mypy and pyright. Familiarity with Haskell is a plus.
Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering: Expertise in preparing and transforming raw data into suitable formats for modeling.
Documentation and Presentation: Ability to generate comprehensive documentation and presentations.
Collaboration and Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively within the team and with other stakeholders.
Analyzing AI Scenarios: Ability to analyze the current basis for specific AI scenarios like Automatic Data Analysis, Root Cause Identification, Mapping Rule Generation, and other relevant areas for large scale data transformations. Identify gaps and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.



About Our Core Products


DCS (Data Conversion Server): An orchestration engine for designing, executing, and monitoring data transformation workflows within SAP systems.
Compose: A programming language for DCS that enables bidirectional compilation, allowing DCS content to be converted into Compose code and vice versa, facilitating version control, continuous integration, and more.



What You Can Expect From Us

An environment that is always open to change and optimization. There is no such thing as ‚Äúthat's the way it's always been‚Äù with us. You have the chance to contribute your knowledge, shape processes, standardize existing topics or optimize workflows. Be a driving force and take us even further with your expertise!

We Create An Environment In Which You Feel Comfortable


Home office contracts
Permanent employment and 30 days' vacation
Trust-based working hours - work in a way that best suits your everyday life and our customers
Mentoring program - a good induction according to your needs for an optimal start with us
#teamgreen - An internal network of experienced experts for mutual exchange and the joint development of solutions to problems
An appreciative employee culture, flat hierarchies, short communication channels and an open-door policy - a team that supports and inspires each other!
Regular team events and workshops on site
With our new health benefit 'Nilo' you get 10 free therapy sessions a year and can use the app for meditations, lessons and courses - all for your well-being!
Further training is a priority



Join #teamgreen - Natuvion is a digital moving company.

Our team doesn't move desks, filing cabinets or chairs. Natuvion moves business-critical data and processes from one technology platform to another. Typical Natuvion ‚Äúrelocation services‚Äù include data migration, data transformation, data integration, data protection, data security and data quality.

Our >400 consultants and developers in Germany, Austria, Slovakia, the USA and Australia have extensive expertise in (SAP¬Æ) projects and a profound understanding of processes across industry boundaries. With a great deal of experience, commitment and dedication, they support our customers with consulting, services and our own software technology. In this way, we enable companies to use their data and processes on the most modern and innovative platforms at all times.

Join us and be a part of a team that is at the forefront of AI innovation, driving transformation and delivering value to our clients and partners. If you are passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we would love to hear from you

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Title: AI Engineer




Location : Remote in Germany (preferably Berlin)




Salary : 65k-100k +




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about AI and its transformative power in education we're reimagining education with AI.




Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you‚Äôll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You‚Äôll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.




Key Responsibilities:

Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of AI (doesn‚Äôt need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company‚Äôs success.
Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Title: Decision Scientist Intern, Digital Marketing
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 20+ markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Vinterns 2025

Our Vintern programme offers a unique opportunity to dive into the professional world with our industry-leading teams. This initiative is designed not just to bolster your resume with impactful work experience, but also to enhance your interpersonal skills through collaborative projects with fellow Vinterns. Here‚Äôs a glimpse of what to expect:


Hands-On Work Experience: Spend 85% of your time working closely with your team, contributing to meaningful projects and gaining insights from experienced professionals.
Collaborative Learning: Dedicate 15% of your time to work alongside other Vinterns, embarking on joint projects that foster teamwork, innovation, and critical thinking.
Personal and Professional Growth: Our programme is tailored to support your development in every sense, preparing you for a successful future by nurturing both your personal attributes and professional skills.


The programme extends from July 1st to October 3rd, depending on the track you choose. To maximise the benefits of the Vintern programme, successful applicants must be available for the entire duration.

In the first week, all interns are invited to our HQ in Vilnius for communal onboarding. It's a fantastic way to meet everyone and get a feel for our culture.

Information about the position

As a Decision Science intern, you will be responsible for analysing structured data with the help of SQL, Python/R, and Looker dashboards. You will apply statistical and econometric methods to understand the impact marketing can have on an overall business. Finally, you will aim to produce business insights and learn to communicate them in a clear and actionable way to other team members or business counterparts. You will be supported by more senior Decision Scientists in the team who will help you onboard, navigate the projects and business environment, and learn about the work we do at Vinted.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Learn about digital marketing and CRM analytics as well as wider marketplace dynamics
Practice hands-on coding and dashboarding skills to answer business questions
Develop analytical and statistical methods to analyse data and understand marketing effectiveness
Support data driven business decision making in marketing via effective communication
Pitch your findings and ideas to the team


About You


Willing to learn new things
Problem solving skills and attention to detail
Passionate about using analytics to support business decision making
Proficient in SQL and one of the Python/R coding languages
Understanding of statistical modelling and econometrics (or equivalent experience in a STEM degree)
Excellent written and verbal communications skills in English
Ready to commit, own and create


Work perks


Gym Membership
Lunch allowance
Team building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
Dog friendly office
Public transport benefit.


Working at Vinted

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The internship pay is 2685 euros/month.

The application window closes on the 21st of March 2025.

Title: Staff Machine Learning Research Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Machine Learning Research Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics..

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior ML researchers and data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating (i) large-scale distributed machine learning trainings, (ii) multimodal machine learning, or (iii) robust machine learning products; 6+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also:


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference in the fight against cancer!

About Us

aignostics.com
Show more

  • You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other teams involved in machine learning and translational research
  • You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
  • You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
  • You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
  • You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
  • You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
  • Educate mid-level and junior ML researchers and data scientists to bring them up to the next level
  • Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
  • Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code

What We Are Looking For

  • Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
  • Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
  • Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
  • Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
  • Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
  • Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
  • Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
  • Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating (i) large-scale distributed machine learning trainings, (ii) multimodal machine learning, or (iii) robust machine learning products; 6+ years of experience with this
  • Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
  • Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
  • Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
  • Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)

Ideally, you also:

  • Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
  • Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
  • Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
  • Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
  • Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
  • Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis

We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer

  • Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
  • Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
  • Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
  • Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
  • Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
  • Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
  • Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
  • Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
  • We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
  • Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
  • Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment

Join us to make a difference in the fight against cancer!

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Data Scientist, Traveler Data Products
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

At GetYourGuide (GYG), we're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.

Join the Traveler Data Products Team, where we are passionate about creating data-driven solutions that empower travelers to discover and connect with the perfect experiences. Our mission is to make our vast inventory accessible and relevant by tailoring it to individual interests, extracting valuable insights from product descriptions, and customizing page layouts to meet our users' unique needs. We are also at the forefront of exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can accelerate the discovery of relevant products, ensuring a seamless and enriching customer journey.

As a valued member of our inclusive and dynamic team, you will collaborate closely with fellow Data Scientists and MLOps Engineers, continuously innovating to enhance the relevance and personalization of the products we display. Together, we strive to make every travel experience unforgettable.

You Will


Develop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.
Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:
Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.
Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.


Who You Are

Ideal candidates will have 2+ years experience in a full time role, covering most of the following areas:


Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a plus.
Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.
Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.
Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.
Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


We value potential and enthusiasm as much as experience. If you are passionate about data science and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the criteria listed above.

How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Aignostics, you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. You translate biomedical challenges into concrete machine learning research roadmaps and coordinate their execution. Together with your colleagues you develop elegant solutions to complex problems, conduct rigorous experiments and finally convince your stakeholders with crystal clear presentations.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Research, pilot and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Support and mentor junior colleagues
Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations


What We Are Looking For


Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and several years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
Excellent communication and team working skills Bonus points for
Experience with development of deep learning models for computer vision
Exposure to biomedical data
Leadership experience in a research context


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development budget, language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
What we do
READ BEFORE APPLYING: Adding a short intro video is mandatory for this position. We do this to get a better sense of candidates before continuing the process. Any application without a video will be rejected by default. Find instructions at the bottom of the post. No cover letter is required. Thank you!


At Briink, we're helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable future by creating the next-generation of AI powered tools for sustainability and ESG teams on the frontlines of solving the climate crisis.




We believe that AI is the key to unlocking the future of sustainable business. With over 50 enterprise clients‚Äîincluding some of the world's largest firms‚Äîwe‚Äôre already transforming how organizations manage their ESG data. Our technology helps sustainability teams uncover actionable insights from unstructured data sources, making it easier to drive compliance, efficiency, and impact at scale.




Backed by ‚Ç¨7 million in capital, including a freshly closed round, and supported by leading venture capital funds, Briink is at the forefront of ESG innovation. We‚Äôre based at the heart of Europe‚Äôs AI revolution‚Äîthe AI Campus in Berlin‚Äîwhere we are building a future where AI helps accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.


Your role


As Briink‚Äôs AI/LLM Engineer, you will work as part of the product and engineering team to bring the cutting edge of LLMs to sustainable finance and help advance Briink‚Äôs mission to accelerate transition to a sustainable planet. This includes both using your knowledge and experience as an AI practitioner to evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM engine, as well as exploring new use-cases for LLMs in ESG and sustainability.





Systematically evaluate and improve our core LLM systems: You will use your knowledge and experience as an AI/LLM practitioner to systematically evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM system and help ensure Briink becomes a world leader for ESG domain specific LLM tools.


Build LLMs into production grade services: On a scale with pure researcher on one side and traditional backend software development on the other side, this leans somewhat more on the software engineering side of the scale, as part of your role will also be to help ensure that improvements to the AI/LLM services are driven through to production and delivering tangible value to our users.


Explore new LLM use-cases in ESG: Both LLMs and ESG are moving very fast and so at Briink we value curiosity and exploring how AI could be applied to new use cases in ESG. Part of your role therefore will be to explore and prototype new ways LLMs could support our users and solve new problems for ESG teams.


Be a core member of the product and engineering team: Briink is a collaborative team and we really enjoy working together to try and build Briink into a successful company that has mission impact at scale. You will therefore work closely as part of a cross discipline team to make sure all the work we do pushes in the same direction and helps achieve our mission.



Your profile

What type of person we're looking for...



Knowledgable and experienced with building AI/LLM products: You have strong knowledge and experience of thinking through and building AI/LLM systems from prototyping and experiments through to deployment, evaluation, monitoring and improvement in production.


Practical Implementer: You are a ‚Äòbuilder‚Äô and aim to pragmatically integrate AI into real-world products, moving beyond research to create tangible, impactful solutions.


Personal agency and drive: must have personal agency, drive and ability to figure things out, learn and iterate to drive initiatives forward to success.


Innovative Thinker: You're driven by curiosity and continually experiment with new models, techniques and technologies in the rapidly evolving AI/LLM space.


Excellent Communicator: You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English, and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners.


Collaborative and Organised: You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve success. Preferably with experience in start-ups.


Passion for ESG and Sustainability: You are motivated by using your skills to help address climate change and enthusiastic about building tools that help ESG and sustainability teams.



Technical Skills



Minimum of 4 years of experience: As an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, AI/ML Product Engineer or related roles.


Fluency in python: Including strong proficiency with base python as well as modern frameworks (e.g. fastAPI)


Experience with LLMs: Including core concepts around foundation models, prompt engineering and chains etc. as well as preferably some experience with LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain). Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.


Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)


Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e.g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP, Modal). Any experience with cost/latency implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.


Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders. Any other European language would be a bonus.


Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.
Even if your experience doesn‚Äôt align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don‚Äôt fit every requirement‚Äîwe believe in growth, not perfection!



What we offer



Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink‚Äôs future.


Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.


Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.


Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.


Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin‚Äôs hub for AI innovation, you‚Äôll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you‚Äôll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.


Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.





APPLICATION REQUIREMENT: Intro Video Submission
As part of your application to Briink, please submit a short intro video (maximum of 2 minutes) addressing the following points:





Brief Introduction:



Introduce yourself and summarize your professional background relevant to this role






Passion for building AI/LLMs:



Share what excites you most about this role and why you think you'd be good at it






Alignment with Briink‚Äôs Mission:



Explain why you‚Äôre interested in joining Briink and how our mission resonates with you.
Technical Guidelines:










Duration: The video should not exceed 2 minutes.


Content Quality: We are not assessing video production skills; using a webcam or smartphone is perfectly fine. Focus on clear communication and authenticity.


Format: In the application form, please provide a link to your video hosted on a platform like YouTube (unlisted), Vimeo, Loom, or a shared drive OR upload the video file under "Other" in the Documents section.
Purpose of the Video:


This video helps us get to know you beyond your resume. We‚Äôre interested in your communication skills, your passion, and how you envision contributing to Briink‚Äôs mission and culture.


No cover letter is required!
Show more
