Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.

  • Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)

  • Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e.g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP, Modal). Any experience with cost/latency implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.

  • Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders. Any other European language would be a bonus.

  • Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.
    Even if your experience doesn‚Äôt align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don‚Äôt fit every requirement‚Äîwe believe in growth, not perfection!


What we offer

  • Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink‚Äôs future.

  • Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.

  • Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.

  • Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.

  • Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin‚Äôs hub for AI innovation, you‚Äôll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you‚Äôll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.

  • Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.


APPLICATION REQUIREMENT: Intro Video Submission
As part of your application to Briink, please submit a short intro video (maximum of 2 minutes) addressing the following points:



  1. Brief Introduction:

    • Introduce yourself and summarize your professional background relevant to this role



  2. Passion for building AI/LLMs:

    • Share what excites you most about this role and why you think you'd be good at it



  3. Alignment with Briink‚Äôs Mission:

    • Explain why you‚Äôre interested in joining Briink and how our mission resonates with you.
      Technical Guidelines:





  • Duration: The video should not exceed 2 minutes.

  • Content Quality: We are not assessing video production skills; using a webcam or smartphone is perfectly fine. Focus on clear communication and authenticity.

  • Format: In the application form, please provide a link to your video hosted on a platform like YouTube (unlisted), Vimeo, Loom, or a shared drive OR upload the video file under "Other" in the Documents section.
    Purpose of the Video:

  • This video helps us get to know you beyond your resume. We‚Äôre interested in your communication skills, your passion, and how you envision contributing to Briink‚Äôs mission and culture.

  • No cover letter is required!

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
Job Opportunity: Senior Backend Engineer (Berlin, Germany)




Location: Berlin, On-site with flexible work-from-home options available




Salary: ‚Ç¨85,000 annually + equity




About Us:

We are a fast-growing startup focused on revolutionizing the customer experience in the e-commerce space through AI-powered messaging. Our platform integrates seamlessly with e-commerce platforms, offering cutting-edge chatbots and virtual assistants that help brands connect with customers. As we expand rapidly, we are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of our innovative product.




The Role:

As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will take ownership of building and maintaining the backend infrastructure that powers our AI-driven e-commerce platform. You‚Äôll work closely with frontend engineers and AI teams to ensure smooth integration between the customer-facing application and the backend systems. The ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys working on impactful, large-scale backend solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Backend Development & Support: Work on the backend system to ensure smooth functionality for the e-commerce platform. This includes working on tracking and messaging structures.
AI Integration: Contribute to the development and integration of our AI-powered solutions, such as chatbots and virtual assistants.
E-commerce Focus: Build scalable backend solutions for messaging and AI integrations tailored to e-commerce environments.
Collaborate with Frontend Team: Ensure seamless communication between backend and frontend systems, working closely with the frontend engineers.
Team Contribution: Collaborate within a small, dynamic team, taking ownership of backend features and helping mentor junior engineers as we expand.




Must-Have Skills:

TypeScript (Node.js): Strong expertise in backend development using TypeScript with Node.js.
E-commerce Experience: Prior experience in developing backend systems for e-commerce platforms, ideally with a focus on messaging or AI-powered applications.
AI & Messaging Experience: Familiarity with building backend systems that support AI-driven tools or messaging platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, etc.
English Communication: Proficiency in English for communication with the team and clients.
Senior-level Experience: Significant backend engineering experience, particularly with building scalable and maintainable systems.




Future Projects:

E-commerce AI Agents: Work on developing AI agents for e-commerce platforms, focusing on messaging and customer engagement through popular platforms like Instagram and WhatsApp.
Onsite Helpers: Contribute to the development of AI-powered helpers, similar to Clippy, for e-commerce websites.




Why Join Us:

Ownership: You‚Äôll have a direct impact on the evolution of our product and play a critical role in shaping the future of e-commerce AI.
Fun Environment: A casual, collaborative culture with opportunities for team activities like bowling, Nintendo Switch games, and classes.
Career Growth: Strong potential for leadership growth as the company expands.
Innovation: Work on cutting-edge AI and messaging platforms that are changing the future of online shopping.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary: ‚Ç¨85k annually, with potential salary increases post-funding.
Equity Options: 0.5-0.75% equity for senior candidates.
Flexible Work Arrangements: Office-based in Berlin with some remote work flexibility.
Visa and Relocation Support: Visa sponsorship and a relocation package (up to ‚Ç¨1-3k) available.
BVG Card and Leasing Scheme: Get support for transportation and bike leasing.




If you're passionate about backend engineering and want to be part of a growing, innovative team in the e-commerce and AI space, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now and join us in building the future of e-commerce!

This version focuses on backend responsibilities, the technical stack, and projects with an emphasis on AI, e-commerce, and messaging systems. Let me know if you'd like any changes!

Title: Senior Data Scientist (d/f/m) - Large-scale Machine Learning
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity ‚Äì without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That‚Äôs where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charit√©), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Data Scientist in Aignostic's foundation model team you will work on our self-supervised base models. Together with collaborators in academia and industry you will push the state of the art in large-scale machine learning for digital pathology. Within our team of experts on large-scale machine learning and data handling, you will work on improving, benchmarking and extending our family of best-in-class foundations models, bridging image, text and other pathology data modalities. Moreover, using our foundation models you will contribute to developing prototypes for new applications to assist pathologists and generate new insights for improving cancer treatment.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Research, pilot and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Support and mentor junior colleagues
Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations


What We Are Looking For


Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and several years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
Experience with developing large-scale self-supervised deep learning models ("Foundation Models") for vision or language applications
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
Excellent communication and team working skills


Bonus points for


Exposure to biomedical data
Leadership experience in a research context
Hands-on experience with developing and integrating Vision Language Models (VLMs)
Experience in considering Information Security criteria under ISO 27001


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charit√©, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000‚Ç¨ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you‚Äôll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

About Us

aignostics.com

Title: Research Sciences Intern (VISION)
Description:
Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential‚Äîand excitement for the journey ahead.

The Applied Sciences Group (ASG) is seeking a highly motivated and talented PhD student to join our team as a Research Intern. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge research in the fields of Large Language Models (LLMs), Vision-Language Models (VLMs), and Generative Image & Video. The successful candidate will collaborate with a team of experienced researchers and engineers to tackle real-world challenges and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies.

Responsibilities


Conduct research in one or more of the following areas: LLMs, VLMs, and Generative Image & Video.
Design and implement experiments to test new hypotheses and validate research findings.
Develop and optimise algorithms and models for various AI applications.
Collaborate with team members to integrate research outcomes into practical solutions.
Present research findings to the team and contribute to publications and patents.


Qualifications

Required: Qualifications:


Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong background in LLMs, VLMs, or Generative Image & Video.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex ideas clearly.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong track record of success, evidenced by publications in prestigious computer vision and machine learning conferences, including NeurIPS, ECCV, ICCV, CVPR.
Proven software engineering capabilities, evidenced by professional experience, internships, impactful open-source contributions, and success in coding competitions.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
AI Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Berlin - (Hybrid/Remote Available)




My client is a fast-growing tech company in Berlin, leveraging AI and machine learning to solve real-world problems. If you're passionate about building cutting-edge AI models and deploying them at scale, they would want you on their team!




What You‚Äôll Do

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll work on end-to-end ML development, from research and model building to deployment and optimization. You‚Äôll collaborate with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to turn AI research into impactful applications.




Your responsibilities will include:

‚úÖ Developing and deploying AI/ML models for real-world applications

‚úÖ Writing clean, efficient, and scalable Python code

‚úÖ Optimizing ML pipelines for performance and efficiency

‚úÖ Working with cloud-based ML infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure)

‚úÖ Collaborating on MLOps and automation for model training & deployment

‚úÖ Staying ahead of the latest AI/ML advancements




Ideal candidate:

üîπ 3+ years of experience in AI/ML development

üîπ Strong programming skills in Python (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.)

üîπ Experience in MLOps and deploying ML models to production

üîπ Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)

üîπ Background in software engineering (APIs, CI/CD, data pipelines)

üîπ Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation




What they offer:

‚ú® Competitive salary

‚ú® Flexible working (hybrid or potentially remote)

‚ú® A high-impact role in a dynamic, fast-growing team

‚ú® Cutting-edge AI/ML challenges & modern tech stack




If you're interested, please apply or send your CV to j.oniah@annapurnarecruitment.com.

Title: AI Engineer (m/f/d) in B2B SaaS AI Startup
Description:
We are traide AI ü§ñ, a groundbreaking deep tech, VC-backed, B2B startup powered by AI ( we did AI long before the hype üòâüòÅ) .




Our breakthrough in revenue, with an increase of over 10x in the past year, positions us at the brink of a significant expansion phaseüî•. By developing the definitive "global trade compliance intelligence platform", building up around our customs classification engine, fully powered by (artifical-) Intelligence, we‚Äôre already transforming the landscape of international trade.




Our product, team, and vision have convinced already prestigious partners like PwC, and our customer base includes industry juggernauts such as Siemens, every day industry Heros like W√ºrth, alongside other notable figures in industry. We are rapidly solidifying our leadership position within the EU while eyeing global expansion üèÜ.




AI is deeply embedded in the DNA of our company, reflected in the extensive AI expertise of our founders, the culture within our company and team, and our proven track record of developing and commercializing AI while delivering real business value with AI-centered features ü§ñ üß¨ . This role aims to strengthen our AI DNA, enabling us to further execute our vision and missionüöÄ .




If you are an exceptional individual and feel that you would be a great fit for our compact yet highly skilled team, let us know about you. We would be delighted to hear from you ü§ùüí° !


Tasks


As an AI Engineer, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with our product and tech team to develop innovative features that address customer needs and drive business impact. In this role, you'll engage in:





Research & Experimentation: Research and delve into cutting-edge AI techniques, prototype novel ideas, and rigorously validate concepts through experiments and metrics.


End-to-End Development: Transform research insights into production-ready features through careful planning, prototype development, quality assurance, and seamless integration of AI functionalities.


Problem Solving & Innovation: With a curious and analytical mindset, you‚Äôll ask the deeper ‚Äúwhy‚Äù questions to uncover root problems, explore creative solutions, and bring them to life.


Take a product-focused approach and care about building solutions that are robust, scalable, and easy to use.





While you‚Äôll take on significant responsibility, you‚Äôre never alone. You can rely on a supportive team where knowledge-sharing and mutual growth are core values.


Requirements



Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in: Data-Sience, Machine learning, Deeplearning and/or Generative AI & AI-Agents. With a proven track record of developing and deploying AI-driven solutions in production environments.


Strong Software-Engineering OR Data-Science background. Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or comparable experience.


Strong analytical, logical reasoning, skills with a creative approach to problem-solving.


Willingness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.


Communication skills, collaborative attitude and ability to work effectively within a diverse team.





Experience with some of these technologies:
- Programming Language: Python (required); Deeplearning Frameworks: pytorch, tensorflow, Other: ML-Ops


Benefits


So, why choose traide AI?




On the product side





Meetings and processes kept to a minimum and focus on getting things done (Kanban Style).


We value clean and well-tested code and ship features only once they are up to standard


Modern tech stack with the opportunity to shape future decisions: React + Chakra-UI, Node.js + GraphQL, Python + Pytorch, LLM/Generative AI and more





In the organization




‚úîÔ∏è traide AI is a place where you can be your authentic self!




‚úîÔ∏è We are creators, not rule followers. In our open culture, ideas take precedence over hierarchies, truth finding is essential üôå




‚úîÔ∏è Our work culture is flexible and grounded entirely in trust and integrity, where everyone strives to grow & learn




‚úîÔ∏è And the cherry on top? Our offices are the coolest around ‚Äì our cozy Berlin office is conveniently located at Rosenthaler Platz and offers fantastic lunch spots.




We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you better üöÄ




If you have any questions, just email us.

Title: DevOps/ML Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Machine Learning Reply, we work with our customers on cutting-edge projects for which we are looking for DevOps and ML Engineers to support our customer projects around machine learning and data processing across various industries. To expand our team, we are looking for a talented and highly skilled consultant with a technical background to join our team. As a consultant, you will be responsible for providing expert advice and technical support to our clients.

If you're a DevOps or ML Engineer or just starting out in the field of machine learning and/or DevOps engineering - if you never lose focus, love coding, data and AI, and are passionate about bringing your ideas to life - then we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:


Design innovative, technical approaches for data intensive and applications with a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Implement and take ownership for your solutions on in either cloud based (AWS, Azure or GCP) and/or on-premises infrastructures of our customers.
Automate recurring tasks by state-of-the-art DevOps and MLOps concepts, enabling your customers to significantly reduce their time-to-delivery.
Take care of the necessary‚ÄØmonitoring, failover, and recovery infrastructures‚ÄØthat allow our customers save operation of their machine learning solutions in agreement with latest regulatory requirements
Closely‚ÄØinteract with customers and stakeholders‚ÄØto translate concrete and complex business requirements into production-ready‚ÄØsolutions
Collaborate with various disciplines‚ÄØsuch as enterprise architects, analysts,‚ÄØdata scientists or‚ÄØdata engineers‚ÄØto develop data-intensive applications such as data warehouses, data lakes and/or data platforms



What we offer you:


Access to work on projects across industries (large and mid-market companies in Banking, Insurance, Automotive, Retail, etc.)
Broaden your skills through interdisciplinary work and training in the areas of data engineering, cloud architecture, and data science
Benefit from industry-leading cooperations in the cloud, BI, and AutoML field
Very active social program - including training, conferences, team buildings, Reply Exchange, communities of practices, and hackathons
Work in an open, flat environment, within a broad Reply knowledge-sharing network
Award-winning office space in downtown Munich with access to ‚ÄúStammstrecke‚Äù
You choose your state-of-the-art equipment
Public transport ticket with Deutschlandticket
Gym-membership subsidy for a gym of your choice
Flexible work environment between client, Reply office, and remote work



Minimum Job Requirements / Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs / master‚Äôs degree in computer science or any other related fileds (e.g. engineering, statistics, physics).
First practical experience with DevOps/MLOps principals and computing platforms like Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP as well as Databricks.
Ability to convincingly communicate and present analytical results to management.
We cover the full lifecycle of Data, from Cloud Infrastructure, Data Engineering, Data Analytics, and Visualization to ML Engineering to and MLOps. Interest and/or experience in some of those fields is an advantage.
Fluent in English and able to speak German at least at a B2 Level.



Desired:


Working experience in cloud technologies (AWS, Azure or GCP), Kubernetes and programming languages like Python, Java and Scala.
Practical experience with SQL and NoSQL database technologies and data lakes
Experience with big data technologies (Apache Spark), data streaming (Apache Kafka) and workflow orchestration (Apache Airflow, Dagster)

Title: Associate Research Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for an Associate Research Scientist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

In this role, you will work as a member of the Research Sciences (RS) department, primarily supporting our work in the UK, Germany, and Japan. This team provides customized real-world data and real-world evidence solutions to address the most important research questions across clinical development, market access, and commercial use cases for our life sciences partners.

In this role, you will:



Develop subject matter expertise in real-world oncology data to support data product development and evidence generation.
Design and conduct in-depth analyses to assess data quality and fitness-for-use for real-world evidence generation in the international markets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including epidemiologists, data scientists, and oncologists, to refine methodologies and ensure rigorous study execution.
Implement statistical analyses by translating analytic specifications from a statistical analysis plan into R code to generate descriptive and inferential statistics and develop visualizations.
Contribute to external scientific publications, including manuscripts and conference abstracts, to advance the field of oncology real-world evidence.
Stay current with epidemiological and statistical methodologies for analyzing observational real-world data and deepen expertise in cancer biology, therapies, and outcomes across multiple tumor types.



Who You Are

You're a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who values the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition, you‚Äôre an analytical thinker and excellent communicator with experience or interest in supporting design and execution of real-world studies that support use cases across the oncology product development life cycle. You are excited by the prospect of rolling up your sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day. Additionally:



You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Health Economics and Outcomes Research, Health Policy (or closely related field) with 2 - 3 years of relevant professional experience, or a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in one of those fields with 4-5 years of relevant professional experience
You have experience working in a pharmaceutical, HEOR consulting, healthcare analytics, or academic research environment
You have experience with observational datasets (e.g., registries, healthcare claims, or electronic health records)
You‚Äôre proficient at coding in R
You have strong communication skills, with experience contributing to study documentation
You have effective organizational, time-management, and prioritization and skills necessary to contribute to multiple high-visibility projects in a timely fashion
You have an agile mindset and adapt quickly to changes in project direction
You are able to quickly learn and apply new information, skills and procedures
You are passionate about our mission to improve healthcare through technology



Optional



You have oncology experience
You are fluent in German



Who We Are

Our people are at the centre of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Workforce)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Workforce) to join our Logistics team to help us create a fast, reliable and transparent delivery experience. You will make an impact in optimizing our on-demand last-mile delivery operations, involving hundreds of thousands of couriers and restaurants, improving the experience for millions orders per day in 70+ countries.


Conceptualize the right modeling approach for challenges in the field of Logistics at scale, together with your squad lead and our stakeholders.
Innovate new modeling solutions by drawing from fields like Machine Learning, Operations Research and Statistics that drive value for our business.
Pair-program with your squad to engineer solutions that automate the retraining of models and generation of predictions.
Provide ideas in brainstorming sessions with your Data Science colleagues to solve the toughest modeling problems together.
Help defining data needs to bring value to the projects and collaborate with the data engineering as well as with the tech teams in planning their roadmap.
Work with (semi-)structured data from our BigQuery DWH architecture and process with Spark where necessary.
Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.
Have fun and grow together with your team.


In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

What you need to be successful


You have at least 3 years of experience applying methods from machine learning to real-world datasets.
Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific/visualization libraries such as Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Plotly etc.
You can transfer business problems from a problem space to a technical solution space.
Experience in solving regression and classification type of problems with statistical, linear/non-linear models and ensemble models in particular (Random Forest/XGBoost/LightGBM/CatBoost).
Experience with Time-Series Forecasting, Operations Research, and Statistics is an interesting addition.
You know how to work with Big Data platforms such as Big Query/Spark and know how to write a SQL query to pull the data you need.
You can write maintainable code that follows best practices in software engineering.
Before starting to work on a use-case, you carefully challenge existing assumptions and care about clean data.
You are a strong communicator and can explain the intuition behind your modeling approach to people with different backgrounds.
You love to learn and you are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different tech teams in a diverse environment.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

  • Pair-program with your squad to engineer solutions that automate the retraining of models and generation of predictions.
  • Provide ideas in brainstorming sessions with your Data Science colleagues to solve the toughest modeling problems together.
  • Help defining data needs to bring value to the projects and collaborate with the data engineering as well as with the tech teams in planning their roadmap.
  • Work with (semi-)structured data from our BigQuery DWH architecture and process with Spark where necessary.
  • Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.
  • Have fun and grow together with your team.

In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

What you need to be successful

  • You have at least 3 years of experience applying methods from machine learning to real-world datasets.
  • Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific/visualization libraries such as Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Plotly etc.
  • You can transfer business problems from a problem space to a technical solution space.
  • Experience in solving regression and classification type of problems with statistical, linear/non-linear models and ensemble models in particular (Random Forest/XGBoost/LightGBM/CatBoost).
  • Experience with Time-Series Forecasting, Operations Research, and Statistics is an interesting addition.
  • You know how to work with Big Data platforms such as Big Query/Spark and know how to write a SQL query to pull the data you need.
  • You can write maintainable code that follows best practices in software engineering.
  • Before starting to work on a use-case, you carefully challenge existing assumptions and care about clean data.
  • You are a strong communicator and can explain the intuition behind your modeling approach to people with different backgrounds.
  • You love to learn and you are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
  • You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different tech teams in a diverse environment.

Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Sports Scientist (m/f/x)
Description:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and passionate individual who is committed to enhancing performance and wellbeing of our clients though data driven guidance. HAGIUS is pleased to offer an exceptional opportunity for a Sport Scientist (m/f/x) to join our dedicated team. With our small team, we provide a unique environment where every contribution is valued, yet our scale is sufficient to have a meaningful impact within the Wellness and Fitness industry.




The ideal candidate will possess a strong desire to assist our clients in achieving their fitness and wellness objectives. If you excel in a dynamic, supportive atmosphere and are keen on collaborating with a team equally committed to health and wellbeing, we invite you to apply.


Tasks



Working in and as part of a team of experts


Conducting personal training sessions and classes


Creating and performing physical assessments (using tools like force plates)


Assessing mental and emotional wellbeing


Analyzing assessment data and setting goals with clients


Creating training plans, schedules, recommendations based on data


Guiding clients through their journey at Hagius


Observing the progress made by clients


Gathering feedback from clients and trainers.


Fine-tune plans depending on progress and assessment data


Ensuring flow of information to the necessary team members



Requirements



Interest in the tasks above


Passion for data-driven fitness guidance


Ability to work as a team player in a team of experts


High-quality education in sports science (University Degree or comparable education)


at least one year work experience in the field of data driven training



Benefits



being part of a passionate team that's striving for honest training with high quality


free participation in classes and usage of facilities





We are looking forward to your application.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world‚Äôs leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We‚Äôre also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Free lunch 2 days per week
Pension plan contributions
Public transportation subsidies
Bike leasing program
Monthly social events, massages, Thursday happy hours, sports teams
An awesome office in Friedrichshain, Berlin


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Lead Machine Learning Engineer

Industry - MedTech

Location - Berlin | Hybrid




About Us:

We're excited to be working alongside is a dynamic and rapidly growing MedTech startup based in the heart of Berlin. They're developing cutting-edge AI-powered tools and their core mission is to revolutionize healthcare by leveraging the power of artificial intelligence and machine learning to improve patient outcomes and empower medical professionals.




The Role:

We're seeking a passionate and experienced Lead Machine Learning Engineer to spearhead the development and implementation of our AI/ML solutions. You will be a key driver in shaping our technology roadmap, leading a team of talented engineers, and ensuring the successful delivery of high-quality, impactful products. You will be responsible for designing, building, and deploying advanced machine learning models into production, optimizing performance, and staying at the forefront of the latest advancements in the field.




Responsibilities:

Lead and mentor a team of machine learning engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
Design, develop, and deploy robust and scalable machine learning models for [specific application, e.g., image analysis, predictive modeling, natural language processing].
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure high-quality data pipelines for model training and evaluation.
Optimize existing algorithms and develop novel approaches to improve model accuracy, efficiency, and robustness.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning and AI, and identify opportunities for innovation.
Integrate machine learning models into our software platform and ensure seamless deployment.
Work closely with product managers, medical experts, and software engineers to define requirements and deliver impactful solutions.
Implement and maintain monitoring systems to track model performance and identify areas for improvement.
Ensure that all developed solutions adhere to relevant regulatory standards (e.g., GDPR, MDR).
Create clear and comprehensive documentation for models, algorithms, and processes.




Qualifications:

Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in developing and deploying machine learning models, with a proven track record of success.
trong proficiency in Python and relevant machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Experience with deep learning, computer vision, natural language processing, or other relevant domains.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).
Experience with data processing and analysis tools (e.g., Pandas, NumPy).
Knowledge of software engineering best practices and version control (e.g., Git).
Experience with MLOps practices.
Proven ability to lead and mentor a team of engineers.
Fluent in English. German is a plus.




What We Offer:

A challenging and rewarding role in a fast-growing MedTech startup.
The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI/ML technology that has a real impact on people's lives.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
A modern office in the heart of Berlin.
The chance to contribute to the future of healthcare.




To Apply:

Please submit your CV as soon as possible to be considered, interviews are ongoing.

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d) Machine Learning Ops
Description:
As a Machine Learning Operation Engineer (ML OPS) you are part of our ED&AA Unit at Siemens Energy and work on challenging projects from all areas of the energy industry. You will transform Machine Learning models to well-engineered products fulfilling development, deployment and monitoring requirements and standards.

Let‚Äôs Talk About You!

What You Bring


Hands-on experience with ML frameworks, libraries, agile environments and deploying machine learning solutions using DevOps principles.
Excellent knowledge of data science programming languages (Python, R, Scala).
Excellent knowledge of the boto3 AWS SDK or additional SDKs for other cloud platforms.
Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure.
Excellent knowledge of container technologies (docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift etc.).
Familiar with REST API protocol as well as at least model serving technologies (MLFlow, Seldon Core, Kubeflow, TFX, Sagemaker endpoints etc.).
Excellent knowledge of the ML life-cycle.
Experience in creation of CI/CD pipelines for machine learning projects.



How You Will Make An Impact


Deploy, operationalize and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models with a focus on optimization of model hyperparameters, automated retraining and model training, version control and governance and model monitoring and its drift.
Establish model onboarding, operations, and decommissioning workflows.
Track, snapshot & manage assets used to create the models.
Enable collaboration, sharing and standardization of ML pipelines developed by data scientists.
Maintain model asset integrity & persist access control logs.
Certify model behavior meets regulatory & adversarial standards. You will be heavily supported by data scientists and Subject Matter Experts in this task
Support model portability across a variety of platforms. We do not have cloud-agnostic ML pipelines, but dependencies should be minimal.
Certify model performance meets functional and latency requirements.
Evaluate design patterns for model deployment. Evaluate design patterns for unit testing and integration testing for machine learning products.
Create and maintain scalable ML Ops frameworks to support product-specific models.



Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With ~100,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we‚Äôre also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character ‚Äì no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits


An inclusive team culture where you can be yourself
Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
Welfare: flexible welfare programs and health insurance.



https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation‚Ñ¢
Description:
SR2 are partnered with a global consultancy who are looking for Data Science specialists.




In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and statistical modeling to help clients uncover trends, patterns, and insights from their data. You will work on projects involving data collection, cleaning, visualization, and interpretation, turning complex datasets into actionable insights that inform business strategy. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in programming languages like Python or R, and experience with data visualisation and statistical techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python and data analysis libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn.
Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Databricks is essential.
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.




Role

6-12+ month contract with high probability of extension
Hybrid with occasional travel to Munich
Candidates have to be based in Germany
2x Stage interview process




If you're passionate about using data to solve real-world business challenges, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: AI & Automation Growth Specialist (F/M/D)
Description:
About Stableton

Stableton is an award-winning fintech private market specialist investment firm and Europe's go-to partner for pre-IPO investing. We empower institutional investors, private banks, and wealth managers to access private market opportunities through our unique, passive index fund-like portfolio of the world's most valuable top 20 unicorn companies and institutional co-investment program. With our remote-first culture, a highly motivated global team, and a track record of innovation, we're shaping the future of private market investments. We are now expanding globally!

About The Role

We seek a trailblazing AI and automation expert to revolutionize our go-to-market strategy, growth initiatives, and operations as we scale internationally. If you're a top-performing, entrepreneurial self-starter who thrives on leveraging cutting-edge AI tools, building automated systems or applying AI agents, and making bold moves, this is your chance to drive real impact.

We're seeking someone who breathes innovation, proactively brings new ideas, and stays ahead of AI and automation trends. This role is perfect for someone who thinks beyond boundaries, takes ownership, and executes fearlessly.

If you're obsessed with leveraging AI to transform industries, this is your chance to make an impact at a high-growth fintech on the rise.

Requirements

What We Expect from You


Design and implement AI-powered automation systems and agents that utilize LLMs to transform our operations and growth initiatives.
Proactively generate ideas‚Äîdon't wait for solutions; create them
Stay ahead of the latest AI agents, automation, and workflow optimization trends.
Embrace an entrepreneurial mindset, take full ownership of automation projects, and drive them to success despite any obstacles.
Make bold moves, test quickly, and learn rapidly‚Äîwe want someone who isn't afraid of failure but sees it as a stepping stone to innovation.
Build scalable automation workflows that can be deployed across multiple departments for maximum efficiency and impact.
Contribute to Stableton's overall technology, growth, and marketing strategy, helping shape the company's future.
Apply your knowledge of fintech and investment products to develop AI-driven solutions tailored to our business needs


Who We're Looking For


Innovative AI & Automation Expert - A game-changer who challenges the status quo, persistently seeking disruptive approaches to enhance workflows, productivity, and innovation using LLMs. A fearless self-starter who thrives in fast-paced, high-growth environments
Results-Driven Problem Solver - A highly ambitious and driven individual who takes full ownership, maximizes efficiency through smart and hard work and continuously pushes the boundaries of AI to deliver beyond expectations
Fluent in English (German is a plus but not essential).
At least one year of experience working with AI applications (beyond AI chatbots)
Available to work during European business hours (CET timezone).
Marketing knowledge is a plus, but your expertise in AI and automation is what we value most



Benefits

Why You Should Join Us


Be part of a high-growth, well-funded fintech and pre-IPO specialist investment firm redefining private market investing
Work alongside a hand-picked team of ambitious, highly-skilled professionals led by serial entrepreneurs
Enjoy unparalleled flexibility, responsibility, and a remote-first work environment (work abroad for up to 180 days per year)
A competitive salary and benefits package that reflects your value to the company
Encounter endless opportunities for growth and development within a company that recognizes and rewards bold, innovative thinking


If you're a top-tier AI and automation specialist ready to make a massive impact, we want you on our team. Apply now and join Stableton in revolutionizing capital markets and private market investing!

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Develop and implement intelligent recommendation systems auto selection of test cases based on changes delivered by development team to system software.

‚Ä¢ Design AI-based frameworks to automatically generate comprehensive and intelligent test cases, improving validation efficiency and coverage.

‚Ä¢ Ensure robust testing methodologies for diverse infotainment functionalities, including edge-case handling.

‚Ä¢ Build and deploy predictive models that analyze system data to anticipate failures, reduce downtime, and optimize performance.

‚Ä¢ Leverage machine learning to monitor and forecast software health in infotainment systems.

‚Ä¢ Utilize large-scale datasets to refine recommendation systems, improve test case automation, and enhance predictive maintenance strategies.

‚Ä¢ Work closely with software developers, QA teams and automotive engineers to integrate AI solutions seamlessly into the infotainment test framework.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address challenges and ensure optimal system performance.

Preferred Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs/master‚Äôs in computer science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.

‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience in AI/ML, with a focus on recommendation systems, automated testing, or predictive maintenance.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in AI/ML frameworks.

‚Ä¢ Strong programming skills in Python or C++.

‚Ä¢ Experience with embedded systems and real-time environments (e.g., Linux, QNX, Android Auto).

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with automotive communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet).

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of test automation and predictive analytics techniques.

‚Ä¢ Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Title: AI Engineer




Location : Remote in Germany (preferably Berlin)




Salary : 65k-100k +




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about AI and its transformative power in education we're reimagining education with AI.




Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you‚Äôll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You‚Äôll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.




Key Responsibilities:

Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of AI (doesn‚Äôt need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company‚Äôs success.
Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Are you passionate about AI and its transformative power in education we're reimagining education with AI.


Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you‚Äôll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You‚Äôll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
  • Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
  • Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
  • Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.


Must-Have Skills:

  • Strong understanding of AI (doesn‚Äôt need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
  • Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
  • Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
  • A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
  • Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.


Nice-to-Have Skills:

  • Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
  • Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.


What We Offer:

  • Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company‚Äôs success.
  • Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
  • Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Title: AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you a passionate AI/ML Engineer looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our team and be at the forefront of AI-driven transformation!

About The Team

Data is the fuel that keeps our world moving, and we at Natuvion are experts in moving large quantities of it. We are a small team of computer science experts dedicated to accelerating data transformation, making it more efficient, pleasant, and secure. Essentially, we operate as a startup within a well-established company. Our team members hold advanced degrees in computer engineering, logic, physics, and related fields, fostering a culture of deep technical expertise and continuous learning. We pride ourselves on our fast-paced development, strong team culture, and open, focused communication.

Why Join Us?


Innovative Projects: Work on designing and implementing fascinating projects like implementing a programming language in conjunction with cutting-edge AI applications.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values open communication and collaboration, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Engage with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to real-world problems.
Professional Growth: Benefit from a culture that encourages continuous learning and professional development.



Your Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms to solve complex problems and enhance our products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Conduct data preprocessing and feature engineering to prepare data for modeling.
Implement and optimize AI techniques such as semantic search, NLP, and recommendation systems.
Ensure code quality and scalability through the use of typing tools like mypy and pyright.
Generate comprehensive documentation and presentations to communicate findings and solutions.
Analyze current AI scenarios, identify gaps, and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning to continuously improve our solutions.



Job requirements

Core Skills


Deep Learning and Machine Learning: Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Understanding of current models and their applications.
AI Techniques and Applications: Experience with various AI techniques such as semantic search, natural language processing (NLP), and recommendation systems.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a strong emphasis on scalable and understandable code using typing tools like mypy and pyright. Familiarity with Haskell is a plus.
Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering: Expertise in preparing and transforming raw data into suitable formats for modeling.
Documentation and Presentation: Ability to generate comprehensive documentation and presentations.
Collaboration and Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively within the team and with other stakeholders.
Analyzing AI Scenarios: Ability to analyze the current basis for specific AI scenarios like Automatic Data Analysis, Root Cause Identification, Mapping Rule Generation, and other relevant areas for large scale data transformations. Identify gaps and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.



About Our Core Products


DCS (Data Conversion Server): An orchestration engine for designing, executing, and monitoring data transformation workflows within SAP systems.
Compose: A programming language for DCS that enables bidirectional compilation, allowing DCS content to be converted into Compose code and vice versa, facilitating version control, continuous integration, and more.



What You Can Expect From Us

An environment that is always open to change and optimization. There is no such thing as ‚Äúthat's the way it's always been‚Äù with us. You have the chance to contribute your knowledge, shape processes, standardize existing topics or optimize workflows. Be a driving force and take us even further with your expertise!

We Create An Environment In Which You Feel Comfortable


Home office contracts
Permanent employment and 30 days' vacation
Trust-based working hours - work in a way that best suits your everyday life and our customers
Mentoring program - a good induction according to your needs for an optimal start with us
#teamgreen - An internal network of experienced experts for mutual exchange and the joint development of solutions to problems
An appreciative employee culture, flat hierarchies, short communication channels and an open-door policy - a team that supports and inspires each other!
Regular team events and workshops on site
With our new health benefit 'Nilo' you get 10 free therapy sessions a year and can use the app for meditations, lessons and courses - all for your well-being!
Further training is a priority



Join #teamgreen - Natuvion is a digital moving company.

Our team doesn't move desks, filing cabinets or chairs. Natuvion moves business-critical data and processes from one technology platform to another. Typical Natuvion ‚Äúrelocation services‚Äù include data migration, data transformation, data integration, data protection, data security and data quality.

Our >400 consultants and developers in Germany, Austria, Slovakia, the USA and Australia have extensive expertise in (SAP¬Æ) projects and a profound understanding of processes across industry boundaries. With a great deal of experience, commitment and dedication, they support our customers with consulting, services and our own software technology. In this way, we enable companies to use their data and processes on the most modern and innovative platforms at all times.

Join us and be a part of a team that is at the forefront of AI innovation, driving transformation and delivering value to our clients and partners. If you are passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we would love to hear from you
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Traveler Data Products
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

At GetYourGuide (GYG), we're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.

Join the Traveler Data Products Team, where we are passionate about creating data-driven solutions that empower travelers to discover and connect with the perfect experiences. Our mission is to make our vast inventory accessible and relevant by tailoring it to individual interests, extracting valuable insights from product descriptions, and customizing page layouts to meet our users' unique needs. We are also at the forefront of exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can accelerate the discovery of relevant products, ensuring a seamless and enriching customer journey.

As a valued member of our inclusive and dynamic team, you will collaborate closely with fellow Data Scientists and MLOps Engineers, continuously innovating to enhance the relevance and personalization of the products we display. Together, we strive to make every travel experience unforgettable.

You Will


Develop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.
Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:
Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.
Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.


Who You Are

Ideal candidates will have 2+ years experience in a full time role, covering most of the following areas:


Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a plus.
Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.
Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.
Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.
Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


We value potential and enthusiasm as much as experience. If you are passionate about data science and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the criteria listed above.

How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
